The Seventh, the issue of developing party members in the base areas. Chen Yun pointed out: to develop party members we must "adopt a prudent policy", "in the army, they must be tested in battle or in the struggle against traitors and deserters. Peasant party members must be chosen and absorbed after a test of struggle." He stressed: "The conditions for developing party members: Three Dares, that is, dare to demand land, dare to struggle, dare to arm; Three Not Afraids, that is, not afraid to leave home, not afraid of landlords, not afraid of the Kuomintang." "Adhere to active development, individual absorption."

The Eighth, the issue of party life. Chen Yun proposed three principles: ① outright and frankly clarify right and wrong; ② strictly implement democratic centralism within the party; ③ every party member has the right to express their opinions and discuss issues within the party, but also must have the obligation to obey decisions and work actively. Mao Zedong pointed out, "The party committee system is the important system of the party to ensure collective leadership and prevent individual dictatorship." He required all party committees and department party groups "must establish a sound party committee meeting system", discuss and solve major issues, and execute separately; "we must also note that collective leadership and individual responsibility must not be neglected."

The Ninth, the issue of rectifying the party member team. The Central Committee believes that enforced commands in party style, deviation from the party's line and policy in thought, tendencies of selfishness and self-interest, and impurity in composition, must be rectified. The method prescribed by the Central Committee for rectifying the party is: first convene two or three branch meetings to educate the party members and prepare their mindset. At the same time, publicize to the masses the significance and methods of rectifying the party, and publish the list of party members.


Then, convene branch meetings with the participation of representatives of the masses, carry out criticism and self-criticism, and listen to criticisms and opinions from the mass, further carrying out self-criticism and introspection within the party. Decisions are made for party members who should be disciplined, and at the same time, decisions are made to correct any improper handling in the past. Finally, through democratic elections, a powerful committee and group leader are elected to take on the regular leadership of the branch; and a system should be established for branch meetings and living, turning the branch into a true advanced conscious organization - the highest form of class organization.

Tenth, to prevent the infiltration of bourgeois thoughts, and to strengthen the ideological construction of the party. Mao Zedong pointed out: because of victory, feelings of pride in the party, the attitude of self-proclaimed meritorious, the attitude of complacency and reluctance to strive for progress, and the attitude of seeking enjoyment and unwilling to endure hardships, may grow. "Because of victory, the people thank us, and the bourgeoisie will come out to flatter.” There might be some communists who "can't withstand the attack of sugar-coated bullets," they will "defeat in front of sugar bullets." He emphasized that to capture the victory of the whole country is only the first step in the Long March, the journey after the revolutionary victory is longer and the work is more arduous. The whole party must continue to maintain the fine style of being modest, cautious, not arrogant and struggling hard.

Section 4 Party style construction

1. The construction of the party's style is a remarkable sign distinguishing the Communist Party of China from other political parties

The party's style construction is our party's unique style. Raising the issue of style to the level of worldview, linking it with the party's line for analysis and resolution, is another significant characteristic of the self-construction of the Communist Party of China, and it is organically tied to the party's ideological and organizational construction. This is a major development in the Marxist-Leninist theory of party building.

The broad connotation of party style is a stable style and spirit often, repetitively demonstrated by a political party and its members in politics, thought, organization, work, and life. The party style we usually talk about refers specifically to the style of the Chinese Communist Party, which is a conventionally used term. It refers to the excellent style of the Chinese Communist Party formed during the long-term revolutionary practice, reflecting the party's nature, purpose, and essential characteristics. The first person to propose the concept of party style and systematically discuss it is Mao Zedong. In 1942, he proposed in the article "Rectify the Party's Style" to rectify the scholarly style in opposition to subjectivity, rectify the party style in opposition to sectarianism, and rectify the literary style in opposition to party "gu". In the "On Coalition Government", he also explicitly proposed the three major styles of Communists that distinguished them from any other political parties: linking theory with reality, maintaining close ties with the masses, and criticizing and self-criticizing. In addition, the Chinese Communist Party has also formed a humble and cautious style in long-term practice, a style of in-depth reality and research, fair and square, equal treatment of people, thrift and hard work, democratic style, for truth, the style of daring to sacrifice oneself for the interests of the people, etc. These reflect the nature of the party, involve the formulation and execution of the party's lines, policies, and policies, and the realization of the party's leadership. Therefore, the construction of party style has always been an important part of party building. The introduction of party style construction theory is the enrichment and development of the theory of the building of proletarian parties by the Communist Party of China.


Firstly, the concept of party style was proposed for the first time in the history of the development of the proletariat party doctrine, adding new content of party style construction in the party building theory.
From the birth of the proletarian party, it began to form a unique style distinguished from other parties, and formed its own party style. But to obtain theoretical expression for this practically formed and existing party style, that is, to form a systematic party style construction theory, is the product of the development of the practice of party style construction to a certain stage. Looking at the development history of the proletariat parties worldwide, Marx and Engels, when establishing some proletariat parties in Europe, elaborated theoretically on why to establish independent proletariat parties, the nature of proletariat parties, worldview, programs, policies, strategies, etc., but did not directly discuss the issue of party style. The practice of party style construction during this period was centered around why to establish an independent proletariat party and how to build a party of the working-class vanguard, guaranteeing the advancement of the newly established proletariat party in thinking and politics, to take on the heavy responsibility of leading and promoting the labor movement in various countries. The statements by Marx and Engels on these aspects laid the theoretical foundation for party style construction, especially their involvement in party style and the content of party style construction in correspondence with labor movement leaders from various countries. There were two more prominent and apparent aspects.
First, the concept of "style" was proposed when discussing the personal conduct of some party members and leaders. For example, in a letter to Johann Philipp Becker, a leader of the German labor movement in 1879, Engels criticized the Socialist Reformers like Hirschberg for "smuggling the style of flattery into the party". In a letter to August Bebel in 1891, Engels pointed out that the party's leading cadres must be generous, "not so petty, less Prussian style in action." In a letter in 1895 to Filippo Turati, a prominent activist of the Italian labor movement, Engels severely criticized the Bakuninists for blindly pursuing a “style of form over substance”, which harmed the socialist party. Here, the "style" concept used by Engels mainly refers to the qualities and styles of party members and party leaders, which is just one aspect of the connotation of the broad concept of party style, but after all, the "style" concept has been proposed and is the initial form in the formation process of the party style concept. Second, when explaining their party building doctrine, they proposed some basic principles closely related to party style construction. For example, they emphasized that party members must be "pure of character," "voluntarily enlist in the ranks of fighters", "prevent the state and state organs from becoming masters of society from public servants"; "I don’t advocate erecting any dogmatic banner," "Marx’s entire worldview is not a doctrine, but a method"; "Criticism is an essential element of the labor movement"; “Ruthless self-criticism” is a manifestation of the party’s enormous internal strength, and actually proposed the idea that the proletariat must cultivate a good style closely connected with the masses, theory connected with reality, and criticism and self-criticism.
Lenin, in leading the Bolshevik Party of Russia, practiced and developed Marx’s and Engels’s ideas on party style construction, especially on strengthening style construction under party ruling conditions. After the October Revolution, Lenin criticized the bureaucratic and sluggish style of the party, warning that one of the biggest and most serious dangers for the ruling party is detachment from the masses; We must resolutely fight against the intrusion of bureaucracy and the idea of promotion and wealth into the party, and against members abusing their powers within the party and the Soviet Union. After Lenin, Stalin further proposed the concept of "working style", and further discussed the two characteristics of "Leninist style": First, the courage of revolution by the Russians; Second, the pragmatism of the Americans.


The style of Leninism is the combination of these two characteristics in the work of the party and the state. Despite the restrictions of historical conditions, Lenin and Stalin failed to explicitly propose the scientific concept of "party style" and failed to form a systematic theory of party style construction. However, they undoubtedly played a significant role in the formation of party style construction theory in terms of inheritance and development of Marx and Engels's arguments on party style construction, especially the exploration of party style construction after being in power and the struggle against bureaucratism and other improper styles. It was against the backdrop of new historical conditions of the Chinese revolution that Mao Zedong inherited and developed the thoughts of Marx, Engels, Lenin, and Stalin on party style construction. Following the path of "style" - "Leninist working style" - "party style", he summarized the fresh experiences in building a pioneering party of the working class under semi-colonial and semi-feudal conditions. He explicitly proposed the scientific concept of "party style" and established a party style construction theory with Chinese Communist characteristics. The proposal of the concept of party style is the theoretical sublimation of the unique experience of the Chinese Communist Party in style construction. The peculiar conditions for the Chinese Communist Party to carry out its own construction and lead the revolutionary struggle determine the special importance of the Party in its attitude towards Marxism, the masses of people, its own shortcomings and mistakes, and the difficulties and failures, successes and victories in revolution. To build a Marxist party in China, a semi-colonial and semi-feudal eastern country, the fundamental rule is to arm the whole party with Marxist theory. This poses a question about the attitude toward Marxism, which relates to whether the party can really become the vanguard of the working class, whether the party can truly shoulder the historical responsibility of leading the Chinese revolution, and the fate of the Chinese revolutionary cause.

In semi-colonial and semi-feudal China, the proletariat and Communists were few, and the revolutionary forces were initially just a spark or a few sparks. The enemies of the Chinese revolution were the powerful and brutal imperialism, feudalism, and bureaucratic capitalism. The Party must adhere to the attitude of historical materialism, treat the masses of people correctly, and maintain the closest contact with the masses. The national conditions of China are different from those of Western Europe and Russia, and the contradictions are very complex and special. To correctly understand the national conditions of China, formulate and implement practical lines, policies, and policies, and achieve the victory of the revolution is a very difficult task. In the process of realizing this difficult task, it is impossible to completely avoid making all kinds of mistakes. Any mistake will cause more or less damage to the people's interests. Therefore, criticism and self-criticism are indispensable for a party that is highly responsible to the masses of the people. It was under such historical conditions that our party, under the personal initiative and cultivation of Mao Zedong, gradually formed a fine style of integrating theory with practice, maintaining close ties with the masses, and carrying out criticism and self-criticism. The concept of "party style" was summed up in order to summarize the unique experience of the Chinese Communist Party in party style construction and to meet the needs of the Chinese Communist Party to build a good party style.

The concept of party style proposed by Mao Zedong, first of all, is the continuation and development of Engels’ concept of "style", Lenin's use of "style" to criticize bureaucratism and sluggardness in the Soviet state apparatus after the October Revolution, and the "Leninist working style" concept proposed and demonstrated by Stalin. This development is shown firstly in the behavior subject, extending from the attitudes and styles of individual party members or cadres to the overall image and demeanor of party organizations. The party style is not only the style of individual party members, but also the overall style of the party organization.



The second emphasis is on the breadth and depth of party style, which primarily extends from the individual character and work style of party members or officials to political, ideological, organizational, and lifestyle aspects, incorporating all learning styles and writing styles within the concept of party style, thereby revealing the inherent connections between party style, party spirit, and the party's worldview.
Secondly, the concept of party style posited by Mao Zedong discusses the importance of party style for achieving the party's political leadership, highlighting that strengthening party style construction is a crucial guarantee for implementing the party's political line.
Mao Zedong pointed out in "Rectifying the Party's Style of Work": "As we are the Communist Party, and we aim to lead the people to overthrow the enemy, our team should be well-organized, and our pace should be unified. Our army should be exact, and our weapons should be reliable. Without meeting these conditions, we will not manage to overthrow the enemy." This tells us that in order to lead the people in overthrowing the enemy, the party must meet ideological, political, organizational, and style criteria. Mao believed that, at the time, the party's political line was correct, but the issue was that certain aspects of our party style were improper, demonstrating subjectivism, sectarianism, and party clichés. Therefore, to implement the party's political leadership and political line, we need to rectify the party's style of work. Under Mao's guidance, our party overcame the three negative trends within the party through the Yan'an rectification, strengthened the construction of party style, and ensured the fulfillment of the party's political leadership. Based on the great success of the rectification, our party held the seventh National Congress. In the political report titled "On Coalition Government", Mao further discussed the significant impact of promoting the party's excellent style for the implementation of the party's Seventh Route Line. Due to the party-wide adherence and promotion of Mao's advocated three excellent styles, various levels of party committees and the vast number of party members and officials can creatively and unremittingly implement the party's political line based on their local conditions and the realities of their units. They transformed the party's line and the guidelines and policies developed for implementing this line into the practical actions of millions of people. In this way, they strongly ensured the realization of the party's political leadership, ensured the final victory of the Anti-Japanese War, and ensured the great victory of the Liberation War. History has proven that promoting the party's excellent work style and strengthening party style construction indeed guarantee the implementation of the party's political line and the realization of the party's political leadership.
Thirdly, Mao's concept of party style discusses the importance of party style issues in the party's self-building and emphasizes the significant relevance of strengthening party style construction for maintaining the proletariat's Vanguard party nature.
Our party's emphasis on party style construction in party building is due to the close relationship between party style issues, the party's working-class Vanguard nature, and the party's worldview. Any improper party style violates the nature and worldview of the party and is therefore "the enemy of the Communist Party, the enemy of the working class, the enemy of the people, the enemy of the nation, and a manifestation of impure party spirit." While a completely proper party style is a benchmark for loyal practice of Marxism and maintaining the working-class Vanguard nature. Therefore, understanding and solving party style construction from the party's worldview's elevation and giving it due attention to the nature of the party is another trait of our party's self-building.
As early as the Land Revolution War, Mao Zedong and Zhou Enlai recognized the significance of party style issues for the healthy development of the party. During the Yan'an rectification, the party central committee and Mao explicitly made party style construction an inseparable part of the party's self-building, took various effective measures to consciously correct improper party style, promote the party's excellent work style, and strengthen party style building. Mao deeply discussed the importance of maintaining the party's excellent work style, believing that the party's three excellent work styles are the distinct markers separating us Communists from any other party.



This argument tells us that the problem of party style is directly related to the nature of the party. Upholding and promoting the fine style of the party can maintain the vanguard nature of the proletarian party; discarding the fine traditions and style of the party can severely affect the vanguard nature of the proletarian party, if the party style is completely corrupt, it may lead to the transformation of the nature of the party. It's precisely because our party attaches great importance to the significant contribution of party style to maintaining the vanguard nature of the party, so we have been able to consciously strengthen the construction of party style in the practice of party building. This is an important reason why our Party has been able to maintain the vanguard nature of the proletarian party in a country where the majority of people are farmers.

Mao Zedong discussed the issue of party style in relation to maintaining the nature of the party, which is not only of great practical significance in guiding us to consciously strengthen the construction of party style in practice, but also of great theoretical significance in social life for people to judge and identify whether a party is a true proletarian vanguard organization. Marxists believe that any political party has its own manifesto, theory, and style. To judge what kind of party it is, we need to look at its theory and manifestos, as well as its style. Marx and Engels first put forward the scientific argument of judging the nature of a party by its manifesto, emphasizing that the party's manifesto is a banner openly erected, and the outside world judges the party by its political manifesto. Lenin and Stalin, in response to the betrayal of Marxist doctrine by revisionists in the imperialist era, put forward the famous argument of judging the nature of a party by whether it upholds the basic principles of Marxism. They believe that any political party that adheres to the basic principles of Marxism is a new type of proletarian revolutionary party; any political party that betrays the basic principles of Marxism is a revisionist or reformist party. Mao Zedong, based on the social and historical conditions in which the Chinese Communist Party is located, further proposed to take the issue of style as an important indicator to judge the nature of a political party. This enriches and develops the doctrine of the Marxist-Leninist party and is an important contribution to the construction of party style.

Fourthly, it discusses the importance of strengthening the construction of party style in order to maintain the high prestige of the party among the masses, emphasizing that only by rectifying the party style can we improve people's morals and social ethos.

From the basic point of view of historical materialism, Mao Zedong believes that what determines the future destiny of the party is the issue of where people's hearts lie. When people are on the side of the party, the party has strength, vigor, and is invincible; when it loses the hearts of the people, the party is powerless, loses vitality, and fails miserably. So, what factors influence where people's hearts lie? For a political party, the most direct and perceptible thing for the people is the issue of party style. From historical experience, whether the people's hearts are with the party is in large part determined by whether what our party does benefits them, especially whether the words and deeds of the broad party members and cadres seek benefits for them, to decide whether to support and follow the party. For a long time, because we Communists are selfless, put others before ourselves, endure hardship first, enjoy later, advance and retreat, fight bravely, everything for the masses, closely connect with the masses, and even shed blood and sacrifice to protect the interests of the masses, we have won the trust, support, affection, and support of the masses. Historical experience tells us that the issue of party style is actually the issue of what kind of posture and style the party appears in front of the people, which directly relates to whether the party can maintain its high prestige among the masses. That's why Mao Zedong always emphasizes that we should uphold and promote the fine traditions and style of the party, always play the role of a model vanguard: a model of bravery in battle, a model of base construction in the rear, a model of taking on heavy responsibilities in work, a model of hard struggle in life, a model of unity and mutual assistance in comrade relations, and so on.



Mao Zedong believed that the issue of party style not only directly relates to the lofty prestige of the party among the masses, but also directly influences, and even to a certain extent determines, the style of the masses. He pointed out in 1942 the importance of rectifying the party's style, and said that our Communist Party is the leader of the people's revolutionary cause, and the quality of our party's style greatly affects the people of the whole country. "As long as our party's style is completely upright, the people of the whole country will learn from us. Those outside the party who have poor habits, as long as they are good at heart, will learn from us, correct their mistakes, and thus affect the entire nation." Mao Zedong explicitly linked party style with public style, which not only stimulates the enthusiasm of all party comrades to rectify the party's style, but also enhances the sense of political responsibility among all party comrades to reform society. This important idea has guiding significance for us today in rectifying party style, promoting social progress, and strengthening the construction of spiritual civilization.

How to maintain and uphold a good style, after hard exploration, our party has proposed and established effective methods and measures for strengthening the building of party style: First, we must solve the problem of party style from the height of worldview and party spirit. This is the fundamental principle that must be adhered to in strengthening the building of party style.

Our party has always believed that the style of the party is closely related to the worldview of the party. The style of the party is the concrete expression of the worldview of the party in action. Our Communist Party's worldview is dialectical materialism and historical materialism. The worldview of dialectical materialism manifested in the actions of the party is the unity of knowing and doing, seeking truth from facts, linking theory with reality; The worldview of historical materialism manifested in the party's action is belief in the masses, reliance on the masses, and close contact with the masses. With the worldview of dialectical materialism and historical materialism, communists are naturally fearless in all practical activities; They dare to criticize various unhealthy phenomena within the party and society, and dare to self-criticize. Therefore, the three virtues of the party are the specific manifestations of the Marxist worldview in the actions of the party.

Since the style of the party is the manifestation of the party's worldview in action, then to promote the excellent style of the party and overcome bad styles, it is necessary to focus on solving problems from the worldview. During the Rectification Period in Yan'an, Mao Zedong's approach to solving the problem of party style was from the perspective of worldview and outlook on life. Firstly, he wrote works such as "On Practice" and "On Contradiction," criticizing the unhealthy styles of subjectivism and dogmatism from a high point of worldview, and profoundly expounding the dialectical materialist worldview of the party, laying a theoretical foundation for the smooth progress of rectification in Yan'an. Then, the Central Committee of the Party and Mao Zedong guided senior party cadre and all party members, starting from studying Marxist theory and party documents, starting from research and investigation, using the method of criticism and self-criticism, to further solve the worldview problems of party cadre and members. The so-called resolution of the worldview of party cadres and members is mainly to guide party cadres and members to apply basic principles of Marxism, link their thoughts to practical working conditions, and consciously transform their subjective world. There are two basic aspects to the transformation of the subjective world: one is the transformation of thinking and consciousness, the other is the transformation of thinking methods. The former is a matter of raising ideological and political awareness, the latter is a matter of improving cognitive ability. These two improvements are the main questions to be answered in the transformation of the subjective world. Because our party firmly grasped the fundamental issue of transforming world outlook in the Rectification Movement, it effectively overcame the problem of "Three Winds Not Right," ensuring the victory of Yan'an Rectification. The three virtues of the party were put forward based on the great victory of the Rectification. This historical experience tells us that only by addressing the issue of party style from the perspective of worldview can we effectively overcome unhealthy tendencies and firmly establish excellent habits.


In the construction of party style, Mao Zedong particularly valued party education, which is the central link in solving party style problems from a world view. He believed that improper party style is a manifestation of impure party nature. To thoroughly overcome improper behaviors, it is necessary to focus on improving party nature and strengthen the proletarian party nature. During the Yan'an Rectification Period, under the advocacy of Mao Zedong, our party made a special "Decision on Enhancing Party Nature," pointing out various manifestations of impure party nature and proposing various measures to enhance party nature, which played a positive role in promoting the good party style and overcoming various improper behaviors. At the same time, Liu Shaoqi also made a report on "On the Cultivation of Communist Party Members," systematically discussing party cultivation. The so-called party cultivation means that Communist Party members consciously use the excellent characteristics of the proletarian vanguard to conduct self-education and self-transformation and gradually possess these positive qualities. One important characteristic of party cultivation is that it is not mainly relying on external force and compulsion, but the consciousness of party members and self-transformation to raise political awareness. The organization's education is very important, and the effectiveness of this kind of education lies in mobilizing the internal positive factors of the party members and relying on the party members' own positivity to conquer their negative factors. Mao Zedong believed that if a Communist Party member and party cadre has a strong party nature, then he can fully play a leading role model in all work. This pioneering and exemplary role is an explicit representation of the good party style. Therefore, strengthening the party's cultivation is the fundamental measure to promote the good party style and overcome various improper behaviors.

Solving party style problems from a worldview also includes another important link and measure, which is to strengthen research and investigation. Mao Zedong believed: "The promotion of investigation and research throughout the party is the fundamental link to changing the party style. He has a famous saying: "No investigation, no right to speak." This idea is a vivid summary of his long-term practical experience in investigating and researching work. It is also a vibrant demonstration of his application of Marxism's dialectic materialism epistemology in the actual work of the party. This is an important condition for us to correct the party style.

Secondly, good forms of rectification and party style have been created, which is a major measure to correct and strengthen the party style.
In order to more effectively overcome the bad habits within the party, promote the good party style, and improve the quality of the party, our party has also created good forms for party rectification. The so-called party rectification is to comprehensively rectify the party's thoughts, styles, and organizations within a certain period. Specifically, in light of some main tendencies existing throughout the party, we select several classic works, party documents, and other leaders' works and reports, link the actual situation of thoughts, style, organization, and work, carry out criticism and self-criticism to improve the Marxist theoretical level and political consciousness of party members and cadres, overcome deficiencies and mistakes in work, and achieve the purpose of unifying thoughts, correcting style, strengthening discipline, purifying organizations, and improving the party's combat effectiveness.

From the Anti-Japanese War to the establishment of New China, our party has carried out three successful party rectification movements. The first was Yan'an Rectification in 1942.


The most remarkable achievement of this rectification movement, as Mao Zedong stated, was that it enabled our leadership organs and many cadres to further grasp this basic direction: "The unity of Marxism-Leninism's universal truths and China's concrete revolutionary practice." The second was the land reform and party rectification in 1948. This campaign revealed the presence of impure elements and styles within the party to some degree, and overcame the tendency of some cadres in rural grassroots organizations to be estranged from the masses. The third was the party purification and rectification movement in the early years of the founding of New China. This campaign greatly enhanced the political awareness of Communist Party members, purified the party team, strengthened the relationship between the party and the masses, and enhanced the leadership of the party.

From these historical experiences, it is clear that party purification and rectification is indeed an effective form of improving the party's work style. This is because: first, the party purification and rectification is a systematic and mass-based Marxist ideological education movement. Through this form of education, the theoretical level and political awareness of the party will greatly improve, communist ideology will be greatly promoted, and individualistic and other non-proletarian ideologies will be further overcome, providing an ideologically solid foundation for improving the party style. Second, party purification and rectification constitutes a comprehensive reshaping of the party's work style and organization conducted in a directed, planned, and organized manner, effectively achieving "comprehensive governance". In other words, it can effectively correct various forms of corruption and overcome feudalism, sectarianism, anarchism, liberalism, and extreme democratization unorganised and undisciplined phenomena. In particular, the latter stages of party rectification entail organizational review and management, not only disciplining those who have committed serious offenses, but also removing those harmful, anti-party and degenerate elements, thus achieving the goal of purifying the organization. In this way, party purification and rectification provides a reliable organizational guarantee for rectifying the party style. Therefore, party purification and rectification is an effective form of rectifying the party style and a major measure for our party to improve its work style. This form of purification and rectification, which Mao Zedong initiated, marks a great innovation in the history of proletarian party building.

Practice and theory are inextricably linked. The fine tradition of combining theory and practice refers to Communist Party members' basic character and style on the issue of understanding and transforming the objective world. The key to this approach is must understand the theory of Marxism-Leninism. Only when it is combined with the concrete practice of the Chinese Revolution does it truly become the weapon with which the Chinese people have been victorious in hundreds of battles.

The Chinese Communist Party, through a long period of revolutionary struggle, has upheld and developed the scientific principle of combining Marxism-Leninism theory and practice, and elevated it to the level of a fundamental principle of Marxism.

The Chinese Communist Party believes that integrating theory with practice is not only an important ideological principle, but also a significant methodological principle. The main content of this methodological principle can be summarized in three aspects: First, the Marxist worldview is not a doctrine, but a method. It does not provide ready-made dogmas, but points of departure and tools for further research. Second, theory must be combined with practice, which is the scientific path to achieving unity of the subjective and the objective, and the harmony of theory and practice. It is also an objective requirement for the goals of understanding and transforming the world. Third, theory can only be enriched and developed by merging with practice, which is the inner demand for the development of theory.

Firstly, the combination of theory and practice is a methodological principle in correctly handling the dialectical relationship between the two. Theory devoid of practice is empty theory, and practice without theory is blind practice. In the history of our Communist Party, whether it's dogmatism or empiricism, both are characterized by a separation of theory and practice, subjective and objective. Dogmatists fail to understand that Marxism is not a doctrine but a method. They separate the universal principles of Marxism-Leninism from the practical realities of the Chinese revolution, refuse to conduct thorough and detailed studies of the practicalities of the Chinese revolution, and apply Marxism-Leninism as an abstract dogma indiscriminately. As a result, the Chinese revolution fell into crisis, with Wang Ming's "Left" dogmatism being the most severe in the history of the Party. Empiricism, on the other hand, opposes the universal principles of Marxism-Leninism to the concrete realities of the Chinese revolution, denying the guiding role of Marxism-Leninism's universal principles on practice and failing to understand that "without a revolutionary theory there can be no revolutionary movement"; they are satisfied with temporary success and a single insight, falling into the error of empiricism. Both tendencies separate theory from practice, and only by adhering to the method of integrating theory with reality, combining Marxist-Leninist theory with the practice of the Chinese revolution, can the Chinese revolution be guided towards victory.

Secondly, the combination of theory and practice is a methodological principle to realize the unity of subjective and objective, and the consistency of knowledge and reality. The fundamental issue of philosophy is the relationship between thinking and existence. This problem includes two aspects: firstly, the question of whether thinking and existence, spirit and matter, subjective and objective are primary. Secondly, is there a unity of thinking and existence, spirit and matter, subjective and objective? The first aspect concerns who determines who between thinking and existence. The second aspect is how to realize the dialectical unity of opposition, interdependence, and transformation of thinking and existence. The fundamental issue in philosophy, when reflected in reality, presents as the relationship between theory and practice. Theory comes from practice, and in turn provides guidance for practice. The unity of theory and practice epitomizes the problem of unity between thinking and existence, subjective and objective. Only by adhering to the method of integrating theory with practice can we achieve unity between subjective and objective, and consistency between knowledge and reality. At the same time, the method of combining theory and practice also embodies the highest principle of Marxist philosophy. The purpose of understanding the world is to transform it, and combining theory and practice is the scientific way to achieve this goal, organically unifying the understanding and transformation of the world.

Lastly, the combination of theory and practice is a methodological principle for the development of theory. Theory comes from practice, and is tested and developed in practice. The detachment of theory from reality is the most fundamental epistemological root cause of the ossification of theory and the failure of practice. Objective things are constantly moving, changing, and developing, and people's understanding should also develop with the specific process of development of objective things. Generally speaking, theory as a form of subjective understanding has relative stability, while objective things are constantly changing and developing, which forms a dialectical process of contradiction between subjective and objective, theory and practice. The task of people's cognition is to seek the concrete historical unity between them.



When the actual process of objective practice has moved forward, subjective understanding should also change accordingly. If the understanding still remains at the original stage, the error of theory lagging behind reality will occur. When the specific process of objective practice has not yet ended, to forcibly do what can only be done in the future, right now, is also an error of subjective-objective split. The method of linking theory with practice is precisely the dialectical method of achieving unity between subjective and objective, theory and practice.

In the practice of our party during the democratic revolution, the combination of theory and practice is emphasized on the following three aspects: Firstly, one must be proficient in Marxist theory, and apply Marxist theory to analyze and explain China's actual problems. Marxist theory is a scientific summary of the practical experience of the proletarian revolutionary struggle. It reflects the general situation and universal laws of the proletarian revolution, and it has universal guiding significance for the proletarian revolution in all countries. However, to use Marxist theory to guide the proletarian revolution in various countries, one must first use the Marxist theory to analyze and explain the specific reality of each country, and combine the Marxist theory with the specific reality of each country.

In the Chinese revolution, the dogmatists did not understand this point. Mao Zedong criticized their mistakes, pointed out their practices, and violated the basic principle of Marx, Engels, Lenin, and Stalin's repeated admonitions to people: the unity of theory and practice. He urged a purposeful study of Marxism-Leninism, as a means to solve the theoretical and strategic issues of the Chinese revolution, to look for position, viewpoints, and methods from Marx, Engels, Lenin, and Stalin. And should apply the positions, viewpoints, and methods of Marxism-Leninism to study China's current situation, to study China's history, to be able to "correctly explain the actual issues that have occurred in history and revolution based on the positions, viewpoints, and methods of Marxism-Leninism, and to scientifically explain and theoretically elaborate China's economic, political, military, and cultural issues. This kind of attitude is a scientific attitude of seeking truth from facts, "It is a manifestation of party spirit, and it is a style of Marxism-Leninism that unifies theory and practice", it is "an attitude that every Communist Party member should have." It can be seen that, here, Mao Zedong regards the use of Marxist theory to analyze and explain China's actual situation as an important content of linking theory with practice.

Secondly, one must base on the actual situation, and combine Marxist theory with the practice of the Chinese revolution. The Marxist theory is a powerful ideological weapon for the proletariat to understand the world and transform the world. Adhering to the principle of linking theory with practice is to give full play to the great role of Marxist theory in understanding and transforming the world. 

In the practice of the Chinese revolution, Mao Zedong attached great importance to the combination of theory and practice, and regarded this combination as an important content of linking theory with practice. In "On Practice," he quoted Stalin's words: "If theory is not linked with practice, it will become a theory without an object. Similarly, if practice is not guided by revolutionary theory, it will become blind practice." To draw the Party's attention to the integration of theory and practice, he understood this combination at the level of Party principles, and believed that: "Without a scientific attitude, that is, without a Marxist-Leninist attitude of unity of theory and practice, it is called lack of party spirit, or incomplete party spirit."



"How to integrate Marxism theory with Chinese revolutionary practice? On the one hand, Mao Zedong sinicized, popularized and massified Marxism theory, integrating it with the practical activities of the Chinese proletariat and the vast population. He pointed out: "Communist Party members are international Marxists, but Marxism must be combined with our country's specific characteristics and realized through certain national forms." Therefore, he required Marxism to be concretized in China, implying that it must bear Chinese characteristics, style, and temperament in every manifestation, thereby being mastered and utilized by the vast majority of Chinese people. On the other hand, Mao Zedong concretized Marxist theory into the party's thinking method, working method, and leadership method, combining Marxist theory with the revolutionary practice of the Chinese Communist Party. The Chinese Communist Party is the core of China's revolutionary cause and the organizer and leader of China's revolutionary cause. Combining Marxist theory with Chinese revolutionary practice is also combining it with their practice. In the long-term revolutionary practice, Mao Zedong established a complete set of scientific thinking methods, working methods, and leadership methods. These methods are not only the concretization of Marxist theory but also the fundamental principles and methods that our Party must follow in all of its work. He proposed the "divide into two," which is both a popularized and massified expression of Marxist dialectics and a basic method that is effective in all Party work. His leadership and work method of "from the masses, to the masses" is both the line and method that our Party must follow in all its work and the concretization of Marxist epistemology and historical materialism. In this way, he transformed Marxist theory into the guide to action for our Party and organically combined Marxist theory with Chinese revolutionary practice.

Third, the development of theory as the highest goal, sum up new theories from the practice of the Chinese revolution, and enrich and develop Marxism. 

Marxist theory is a scientific truth that comes from the practice of proletarian revolutionary struggle and is proven by the practice of proletarian revolutionary struggle. Like any truth, it does not end the truth but opens the way to truth. With changes in objective reality and the development of practice, Marxist theory must also be constantly enriched and developed. Otherwise, Marxist theory will not be able to adequately explain and describe objective reality, will not be able to effectively guide practice, and will inevitably lead to a separation of theory and reality. On this basis, the Chinese Communist Party attaches great importance to the enrichment and development of Marxist theory in the revolutionary practice and regards the enrichment and development of Marxist theory as an important content of integrating theory with practice. In the Chinese revolution, Mao Zedong regarded the enrichment and development of Marxist theory as important content in integrating theory with practicality, and specifically pointed out that "Chinese Communists only when they are good at applying Lenin's Stalin to the Chinese revolution, further serious study of Chinese historical reality and revolutionary reality, make theoretical creations that meet China's actual needs in all aspects, are called theoretical contact with reality." Mao Zedong further pointed out later: Marx, Engels, Lenin's books, must read, this is the first. But the communists of any country, the proletarian thinkers of any country, must create new theories, write new works, and produce their own theorists to serve current politics. Any country, at any time, relying on old things is not enough.

The content of the three aspects of the theory of practice in the thought of the Chinese Communist Party is interrelated and emphasized. From a connection perspective, the three aspects of the content in the theory of practice are an organically indivisible whole. The use of Marxist theory to analyze and explain China's actual problems are the basis or premise of the theory of practice."



To apply Marxist theory to the concrete reality of China, we must first use Marxist theory to analyze and explain the actual problems in China, so that Marxist theory aligns with the specific reality of China. Without analysis and explanation of China's specific reality, it would be impossible to link Marxist theory with the practice of China's revolution and construction, and the enrichment and development of Marxist theory would be out of the question. Combining Marxist theory with the practice of the Chinese revolution is the fundamental approach to connecting theory with reality. Without this combination, the analysis and explanation of actual problems would lose their significance, and Marxist theory would not be able to serve as a powerful force for transforming the world and changing reality. It would inevitably result in a separation between theory and practice, and the enrichment and development of Marxist theory would be nothing more than empty words. The process of summarizing new theories from the practice of the Chinese revolution and enriching and developing Marxism is an inevitable requirement in relation to actualities. Objective reality is rich and colorful, and constantly changing and evolving, as is the practice of revolution. As theory is a reflection of objective reality and a generalization of practical experience, it must also change according to changes in objective reality and develop along with the progress of practice. Otherwise, theory will fall behind reality. 

Viewed from differences, the three areas of content in the thought of linking theory to practice each have their own emphases, forming three levels from low to high. Using Marxist theory to analyze and explain China's actuality focuses on understanding and recognizing China's social, political, economic, military, and cultural realities. It only resolves the issue of how to correctly perceive and reflect objective reality. This connection between theory and practice is a lower-level connection. Combining Marxist theory with the practice of China's revolution and construction focuses on using Marxist theory to transform and change objective reality. It resolves how Marxist theory transforms the world and changes reality. As it delves into the transformation and change of objective reality and doesn't merely stay at reflecting objective reality, this connection between theory and practice is a higher-level connection than simply using Marxist theory to analyze and explain China's reality. 

Summarizing new theories from the practice of the Chinese revolution and enriching and developing Marxism, on the other hand, emphasizes the generalization and summary of practical experiences and theoretical creation. It resolves how Marxist theory reflects the changing and developing objective reality, and guides the constantly developing practice. As it not only reflects objective reality and guides practice, but also further enriches theory, this connection between theory and practice is a high-level connection. If we deny their differences and mix the content of the three levels, or replace high-level connections with low-level ones, it will inevitably lead to a separation between theory and practice and unconsciously violate the principle of linking theory to practice.

Third, Style of Criticism and Self-Criticism

Upholding the style of criticism and self-criticism refers to the character and style communists should possess on the issue of correctly understanding and transforming the subjective world. The basic point of this style is that transforming the old society and establishing a new society is a difficult and novel undertaking. In the long process of revolution, it is inevitable to make some, even serious, mistakes; to adhere to the truth, and rectify errors is the only way for a revolutionary party and a communist to mature and achieve victory. Criticism and self-criticism are the internal forces for the party to correct errors and move forward constantly. Criticism and self-criticism are inherent requirements for the survival and development of the Communist Party. 

The revolutionary mentors



Without criticism, there is no mutual understanding, and thus there is no unity. He also emphasized that a proletarian party must have the courage to criticize and self-criticize, and whether having this courage or not indicates whether the party has a strong vitality; it means whether the party can withstand various tests. He proudly said, "Where else is there another party that dare to do this?"
Lenin, in the process of founding and leading the proletarian revolutionary party, attached great importance to the cultivation of a self-critical style. He stated that self-criticism is absolutely necessary for any vibrant and energetic party. He believed that the attitude a party holds towards its own mistakes is the most important and reliable measure of whether the party is serious and truly fulfills its obligations to its class and the working masses. Openly admitting mistakes, revealing the causes of mistakes, analyzing the environment in which mistakes occur, and carefully discussing the methods of correcting errors are the signs of a serious party. It is the duty of the party, and it is the education and training of the class, and even the masses.
The reason why the proletariat party is different from other parties is fundamentally because it is a selfless party, its purpose is to wholeheartedly serve the people, and this provides the possibility for the development of criticism and self-criticism. Criticism and self-criticism are the valuable traditions and political advantages of our party.
The Communist Party of China, led by Marxism and established in accordance with Lenin's party building principles, has inherited the fine tradition of criticism and self-criticism in the international socialist movement and creatively developed it in leading the Chinese revolution, forming a good style of criticism and self-criticism with its own characteristics.
In our party, the first-generation central leadership led by Mao Zedong first created a new method of rectifying the party through criticism and self-criticism. Starting from the Yan'an rectification period, Mao Zedong often used metaphors like "washing face every day", "sweeping the floor every day", "flowing water does not rot", and "the household hinge does not rust", to vividly and profoundly explain the necessity of self-criticism among communists. He pointed out that in the party, there are always contradictions between the advanced and the backward, the right and the wrong. The progress of the party is based on the continuous unfolding and resolution of these contradictions, and criticism and self-criticism are the main methods to solve contradictions within the party. Mao Zedong said, "The members of the Communist Party of China who start from the maximum interests of the broadest Chinese people and believe that their cause is completely justified, are willing to sacrifice everything, are always ready to give their lives for our cause. Is there anything that does not meet the needs of the people, views, opinions, methods that they do not want to throw away? Do we still welcome any political dust, political microbes to tarnish our clean face and erode our healthy body? Countless revolutionary martyrs sacrificed their lives for the interests of the people, and everyone who thinks of them feels sad. Do we have any personal interests that cannot be sacrificed, and any mistakes that cannot be abandoned?" It is this thorough materialist attitude that has helped the Chinese Communist Party form and develop a set of effective guidelines and methods for conducting criticism and self-criticism. They are the precious spiritual wealth of our party, and they have effectively ensured the complete victory of the new democratic revolution from an organizational point of view. Whether there is serious criticism and self-criticism is an important symbol to test the party nature of party members. First of all, self-criticism is the basis for carrying out party criticism: our party is the vanguard of the Chinese working class and a faithful representative of the interests of the people of all ethnic groups in China. This determines that all its speeches and actions must be highly responsible to the masses, does not allow any special interests of its own to exist, and does not allow any shortcomings and mistakes that harm the interests of the people to exist. Therefore, our party solemnly declares to the masses: persist in what is good for the people's interests and correct what is wrong for the people's interests. This is also the standpoint and starting point of our party's self-criticism.



It is precisely because self-criticism is based on the interests of the people that its smooth progress is the foundation for the healthy development of intra-party criticism. 
Through self-criticism, we can strengthen the cultivation of party members and create good ethical conditions for intra-party criticism.
The consciousness of self-criticism is built on the basis of correct self-evaluation. To make a correct evaluation of oneself, one cannot do without one's own moral cultivation and the cultivation of moral judgment standards. The so-called moral judgment, colloquially speaking, refers to a person judging the right and wrong of others' actions and measures based on their political views and moral views. This is a kind of rational and emotional power from the heart, and is a value concept formed by people's social status, education level, and experience in transforming objective world practice. The closer this value concept is to the scientific worldview, the better it can blend with the interests and emotions of the vast number of people, and the more accurately it can distinguish between good and evil, right and wrong. Thus, it can more consciously adhere to correct behavior, correct erroneous behavior, and generate internal requirements for self-criticism. A person's moral cultivation is the spiritual force that drives self-criticism, noble moral power, encouraging people to take a non-conservative and proactive improvement attitude towards their own shortcomings and mistakes; and this proactive attitude will make one's spiritual realm broader and moral cultivation more perfect. A person with ideal goals and moral pursuits, in order to fulfill his responsibilities for the people's interests, does not allow indulgence in self, stagnation, the consciousness and initiative of self-criticism will be greatly enhanced.
Through self-criticism, we can promote the spirit of democracy within the party and create a good practical foundation for intra-party criticism.
It is easy to listen to good words, but it is difficult to listen to different opinions; it is easy to criticize others, but it is difficult to actively self-criticize, which is a common problem among party members and party cadres. There are various reasons for this problem, but fundamentally, the indifference to the spirit of democracy is an important aspect. Unquestionably, treating each other equally is an important principle for party comrades to handle their relationships. In our party, although there is a subordinate relationship between superior and subordinate in work, they are equal in observing the principle of democratic centralism of the party and party discipline and law. However, some comrades, especially some leading cadres, are indifferent to democratic concepts, consider themselves as patriarchs, have a rough style, often teach and criticize others, they cannot be pragmatic when criticizing others, and they cannot be fair and just when dealing with problems. The lack of an active and proactive style of self-criticism is an important reason for the weakness of democratic consciousness. The practice of party construction tells us that in order to create a lively and relaxed environment for party development, we must open the door to the spirit of democracy, be able to listen to various opinions with an open mind. If you are wrong, do not insist on your own opinions. If others are right, follow the good. Only in this way can we correctly link the party with the people, truly form an upward spiritual outlook within the party, and promote the vigorous development of the revolutionary cause.
Through self-criticism, we can promote unity within the party and create a good organizational atmosphere for intra-party criticism.



To solve problems proactively and preemptively, we need to actively engage in self-criticism, enhance sincere communication and heart-to-heart talks, and do a good job in resolving conflicts, unifying thoughts and uniting comrades. We should always adhere to the principle of people-oriented, respecting, understanding, and caring for people. We need to put ourselves in others' shoes, treat others equally, emotionally appeal to people, and persuade others with reason, while avoiding simple, crude, and forcibly commanding actions. By innovating in content, form, and methods, it addresses the hot and difficult issues existing in the thoughts of Party members, deeply exchanges opinions and views, and does a good job in clarifying doubts, uniting people's hearts, guiding emotions, and resolving conflicts. In short, we must fully understand the difficulty and complexity of the development of the Party's construction under the new situation and use the high-quality results of self-criticism to create a good atmosphere for unity and development. 

Secondly, the criticism is the political responsibility of Communist Party members: Comrades with Party life experience all have a feeling that it is easy to talk about criticism, but it is difficult to carry it out. The carrying out of criticism always unavoidably reveals contradictions and touches on the sore points. Therefore, the situation of "planting more flowers and fewer thorns" in Party life is widespread. However, the party principle tells us that this attitude towards criticism is incorrect and is non-Marxist.

Everything in the world is full of contradictions, and all things advance and develop in their own contradictions. The same is true for our party. If there are no contradictions in the party and ideological struggles to resolve contradictions, the life of the party will cease. Engels said early on that it seems any working-class party in a big country can only develop in internal struggles, which conforms to the general law of dialectical development. Recognizing contradictions, facing contradictions, and correctly handling and resolving contradictions are essential ways to transform the subjective world with Marxism while transforming the objective world. In other words, the so-called attitude of "planting more flowers and fewer thorns" is the abandonment of extreme ideological struggles and the advocacy of giving up the principle of "peace of mind". It is a party-like attitude to replace the maintenance of party and people's interests with the attitude of "not offending anyone"; it advocates not criticising, resisting, not resisting, trivialize big issues, and trivial issues. These are all manifestations of losing party spirit. In party life, actively carrying out criticism activities and opposing the principleless peace of cancelling ideological struggles, should be the political responsibility of each party member.

Practice has proven that the political responsibility of carrying out intra-party criticism is specifically manifested as: it is the process of party members renewing efforts to adapt to the party's building and development needs; it is the process of each party member correctly treating comrades and themselves; it is the process of party members accepting Communist thoughts training and education.

Finally, to carry out intra-party criticism, we should follow the correct principles and methods: "To do a good job, tools are necessary." This "tool" refers not only to tools but also to methods. We have a good style and weapon of criticism and self-criticism, and we should not only dare to use it, but also be good at using it. Otherwise, it will not only be ineffective, but it may even backfire. Only by having weapons and correct principles and methods to use weapons can we achieve the expected purpose of criticism and self-criticism.


Firstly, we must carefully summarize the experience and lessons learned from carrying out intra-party criticism.
Our party is armed with advanced theories and organized according to the principles of democratic centralism, which is a Marxist party. Therefore, for a long time, we have paid great attention to using the weapon of criticism and self-criticism to strengthen the construction of the party's advancement. The practice of the party's successful leadership in the Chinese revolution fully proves that our party is good at self-criticism, self-improvement, and self-improvement. It is a party that can discover and solve the contradictions within the party and correct its own mistakes and problems by relying on its own strength. In this historical process, we have accumulated a wealth of experience. They mainly show as the following points: Starting from the overall situation of the cause, adopting a kind attitude towards people, we avoid blindly labeling, arbitrarily criticizing, and irrelevant nitpicking. We do not unnecessarily escalate issues, and we form a good atmosphere where everything is spoken out, all words are exhausted, there's no blame in speech, and the listener takes a precaution.
②We need to have correct methods. In intra-party criticism, we should be "gentle as drizzling", calm, and absolutely avoid the erroneous practices of "leftist" dogmatists who adopt "cruel struggle and ruthless strike".
③We need to have correct standards of right and wrong. The party constitution and the party's basic line and policies should be used as the standards of right and wrong. Criticism should focus on political and principal issues, and we cannot cause principle-less disputes or get entangled in trivial matters. 
④When carrying out criticism and self-criticism, we must also adopt an attitude of seeking truth from facts. We should emphasize evidence in our speech, avoid making unwarranted assumptions, exaggerations, and unnecessary escalations. We should persuade people with reason instead of force. We should not just focus on one point and ignore others. Moreover, we cannot make up and frame others under the guise of criticism.
Secondly, both towards others and ourselves, we must adhere to the principle of seeking truth from facts.
Seeking truth from facts is our party's fundamental line and fundamental style. It is also the party's basic leadership method and working method. When criticizing and self-criticizing, we must pay attention to implementing the principle of seeking truth from facts. We must rely on facts, present the facts, reason logically, and we must not unnecessarily escalate matters, and certainly, never fabricate things out of nothing.



To make the facts clear, what exists, exists, what doesn't, doesn't. We absolutely cannot rely on subjective imagination, wild conjecture, or hearsay. We must firmly resist such egregious behaviors as framing others, slander, and fabrication of facts. Always remember: "When speaking, one must have a basis, and when making criticism, one must consider the political implications." Ill-founded criticism only fosters mutual suspicion and vigilance and leads to principle-less disputes within the party.

It is imperative to distinguish the nature and extent of mistakes made. One should neither exaggerate nor diminish them, and should not treat occasional errors as consistent ones. Do not portray partial issues as systemic, or academic and perception issues as political problems. Never overgeneralize or confuse the nature of contradictions. Treat both oneself and others historically and dialectically to fully evaluate and view them. Do not erase merits because of mistakes made nor cover mistakes due to merits gained. Be aware not only of strengths and advantages but also of weaknesses and shortcomings, so as to accept criticism. When assessing others, not only consider their shortcomings and flaws, but also their strengths and advantages. This will allow us to evaluate a person objectively and dialectically and not deny his correct propositions when criticizing a comrade.

We must allow those being criticized to retain their views or to explain, argue, and counter-criticize. If the critic realizes that the criticism was wrong, it must be corrected quickly, and never persist mistakenly just for the sake of it, which will cause unnecessary harm to comrades. Only with a serious attitude toward oneself, others, and the party's cause, and a firm adherence to the principle of seeking truth from facts, can a good environment for criticism and self-criticism be created and truly fulfill the original intention of using this sharp ideological weapon.

Thirdly, starting from a desire to care for and help comrades, we should both clarify ideas and unite wills. 

When we undertake criticism and self-criticism, we must always bear in mind the purpose of using this weapon. We carry out criticism and self-criticism not to knock down or alienate others, but to help comrades overcome their shortcomings, progress jointly, and achieve party unity and cohesion at higher standards. On this, Mao Zedong propounded insightful theories. He pointed out: "In 1942, we formulated a concrete formula for solving internal contradictions among the people in such a democratic manner—'unity-criticism-unity.' To be more specific, we start from a desire for unity, resolve contradictions through criticism or struggle, and then achieve new unity on a new basis." He believed, "Here, the prerequisite is to start from a desire for unity. If there is no such desire subjectively, any fight will inevitably lead to chaos, which can't be handled, wouldn't that be 'cruel struggle, merciless blow'? What's left for the unity of the party? Based on this experience, we have found a formula: unity-criticism-unity, or punish before, comfort after; cure diseases, save people."



Therefore, when we conduct internal criticism within the party, we must start from the desire for unity, and from the desire to care for and help our comrades. Otherwise, it violates the essence and requirements of carrying out criticism and self-criticism, which will inevitably lead to results that contradict our original intentions. 
Fourth, we must inspire party members to promote the internal motivation for criticism and self-criticism. 
Party members are the cells of the party's body and the main actors of the party's activities. Whether they can truly inspire the internal motivation of the majority of party members is fundamentally related to whether they can actively and correctly carry out criticism and self-criticism. Therefore, our party emphasizes: 
Party members must be made truly aware of the necessity and importance of criticism and self-criticism. Criticism and self-criticism are sharp ideological weapons for strengthening the party's advanced nature construction, and they are the good traditions and styles that our party has constantly glorified and maintained for a long time. They are the important magic weapons to enhance the party's vitality and vitality, and they are also the distinctive signs of our party, which distinguish us from any other political party. Only when the majority of party members realize this can they greatly improve their initiative to carry out criticism and self-criticism. Party members must truly establish correct principles of right and wrong, and consciously use these principles to measure their own thoughts and actions. The majority of party members and cadres should earnestly study Marxist theory and consciously arm their minds with scientific theory. On this basis, we should strictly compare with the party member standards stipulated in the Party Constitution, seriously self-examine, find out the gaps and outstanding problems, carry out introspective analysis and reflection from the depth of our thoughts, make sure to speak the truth without face, speak principles without relationships, speak party nature without personal feelings, and to eliminate mistakes in the bud state in time, accumulate experience of distinguishing right from wrong, improve their ideological level and work ability, effectively play the exemplary leading role of party members, further improve the party's work style, and elevate the party's work style construction to a new level. 
We should learn to absorb political nutrition from criticism. For us Communists, criticism is like air, water, and sunlight, an indispensable element in life, and a magic weapon for preserving political youth. It is inevitable for a person to have shortcomings and mistakes in their daily work due to the inconsistency of subjective and objective conditions, and the ability of self-knowledge is limited. Regardless of how strict their self-dissection is, it is not easy to see their own shortcomings and insufficiencies. Therefore, the vast majority of party members and leading cadres can only make progress by sincerely accepting others' criticism and constantly absorbing nourishment from it.
We need to enhance the subject consciousness of party members. Party members are the main body of all activities within the party. The formulation and implementation of the party's line, principles, and policies depend on the active participation of the majority of party members; the good image of the party depends on the efforts of the majority of party members and grassroots party organizations to establish and maintain. Therefore, the majority of party members must enhance their sense of honor and responsibility as a Communist Party member, consciously use the sharp ideological weapon of criticism and self-criticism in their daily life and work, actively carry out ideological struggle, clean up the dust in their thoughts, adhere to the good, and correct the wrong.



Fifthly, we should actively make use of the form of heart-to-heart talks. Heart-to-heart talks have always been an effective method in the ideological and political work of the Chinese Communist Party, especially an effective carrier for criticism and self-criticism. Experience has shown that when carrying out criticism and self-criticism, it often has effects that other methods do not. In heart-to-heart talks, everyone identifies problems, meets with sincerity, communicates with each other, and improves together. This has played an important role in promoting the Party's cadres to closely connect with the masses, to harmonize the relationship between the Party and the masses, and to unify the thinking and strengthen the unity of the broad masses of cadres and the masses.

Four, The Style of Closely Linking with the Masses

The style of closely linking with the masses refers to the basic qualities and style that communists should have in dealing with the people. In the long-term revolutionary struggles, our Party has formed a deep connection with the people. This connection has undergone tests in various complex and dire situations and has become the source of strength and effective weapon for our Party's revolutionary and construction work. The Marxist mass historical outlook is the theoretical foundation of our Party's close relationship with the masses. Marx said, only when the theory is thorough, can it persuade the masses. Therefore, the primary issue for the close relationship between the Party and the masses is the correctness of the Party's theory. The Marxist mass historical outlook is the theoretical foundation of our Party's close relationship with the masses. Is it the people or the hero who creates history? This is a fundamental divergence between historical materialism and historical idealism. Before the advent of Marxism, almost all historians and philosophers advocated the heroic historical view, believing that history was created by some great figures or a few elites. This is because they do not fully understand the fundamental principle that social existence determines social consciousness. Therefore, they inevitably cannot have a correct understanding or make a correct evaluation of the decisive role of the masses in history. They all excessively exaggerate the roles of a few outstanding figures, heroes, emperors, and generals in history, considering them as the masters of history, while the masses are tools to be manipulated. The advent of Marxism scientifically answers the basic question of historical outlook from the height of philosophy for the first time. It is not that people's social consciousness determines people's social existence, but people's social existence determines social consciousness. And the so-called social existence, fundamentally, is the mode of material production. The mode of material production is the determining force of social development. In the mode of production, the productive forces are the most active and revolutionary factors. Therefore, the history of human society, first and foremost, is the history of material production, and thus also the history of the main body of material production - the masses. All material and spiritual civilization in human society ultimately comes from the creation of the masses. The people are the decisive force driving the development of history and the true masters of history. Of course, Marxism also acknowledges the significant role that individuals, especially outstanding ones, play in history. It believes that if there were no outstanding thinkers, politicians, and military strategists to enlighten the masses, organize their strength, point out the way forward, and guide the revolutionary struggle from the forefront, it would be impossible for the people to achieve victory. But it also emphasizes that an individual can only belong to the collective as an ordinary person.



On the basis of contradictions within the mode of production caused by the development of productive forces and various factors and objective conditions such as politics and economy, great figures can make a difference. The principle of Marxism that the masses are the creators of history scientifically solves the relationship between the law of social historical development and the practical activities of the masses, highly summarizing the decisive role of the masses in social historical development. It lays a solid theoretical foundation for the proletariat party to establish a mass perspective and formulate the correct line of party building.
