Starting from this principle of historical materialism, the revolutionary mentors of the proletariat, in their struggle to establish the workers' party - the Communist Party, always regarded the party's close connection with the masses as a basic principle of party building. They emphasized that the party established by the working class itself must be a party that never leaves the masses, a party that represents the fundamental interests of the masses, a party that seeks the interests of the majority. Marx and Engels clearly pointed out in the "Communist Manifesto": "Communists have no interests different from those of the entire proletariat."

Lenin, in leading the creation of the world's first proletarian dictatorship, further developed the Marxist mass historical view of party building, proposing that we need a new type of party, a party of a different nature. The party we need should be a party that is truly connected with the masses and good at leading the masses. At the same time, Lenin believed that the power of the masses is the source of victory. To achieve revolutionary victory, the party must not only win the sympathy and support of the vast majority of workers, but also organize and lead the masses. Organizing tens of millions of working masses is not only the most favorable condition for revolution but also the deepest source of revolutionary victory. It was by following Lenin's teachings that the Bolshevik Party of the Soviet Union made great efforts to organize and mobilize the masses, leading them to a great victory in the October Revolution. After the victory of the October Revolution, the status of the party changed fundamentally, and the masses became the masters of the country. Lenin believed that during the entire period of socialist construction, the working masses are the basis of all state life and the fundamental guarantee of the Soviet Republic. The vigorous creativity of the masses is a basic factor of the new society. Only when the masses participate in state construction can socialism be built. Therefore, for the ruling party, it should have extensive contacts with the masses, trust the masses, and rely on the masses to consolidate its power and carry out socialist construction. Lenin also pointed out that one of the biggest and most serious dangers for the vanguard of the working class is to detach from the masses and generate bureaucracy. In order to prevent this phenomenon, party building must be strengthened, mistakes in the work must be overcome, and the party must always maintain close contact with the masses. Lenin made many efforts in practice, not only emphasizing respect for the historical status of the masses as masters but also selecting outstanding workers and laborers to participate in state management and requiring party members and non-party members to supervise each other. It was precisely because of Lenin's and the Bolsheviks' efforts that the close connection between the party and the masses was ensured, enabling the young Soviet government to be consolidated and achieve rapid development of socialist construction in a short period of time. Close contact with the masses is our party's political advantage. The Communist Party of China was established under the guidance of the basic theory of Marxism-Leninism, educated and armed with Mao Zedong Thought, and also developed and matured in close contact with the masses and joint struggle. With Mao Zedong as the representative, the Chinese Communists, in leading the long-term practice of the Chinese revolution and construction, not only cultivated the fine traditions and style unique to the Chinese Communist Party, but also creatively proposed a mass line with Chinese Communist characteristics. That is, everything is for the masses, everything relies on the masses, and everything comes from the masses and goes to the masses.



The theory of the mass line of the Communist Party of China was formed as early as the period of the Land Revolution War. In September 1929, the "Directive Letter from the Central Committee to the Preparatory Committee of the Fourth Red Army" detailed the relationship between the Red Army and the masses, emphasizing that "the work of the party and the Red Army in the masses must go through the mass line". This was the first time in the history of the Chinese Communist Party that the concept of "mass line" was used. In 1933, Mao Zedong discussed repetitively in "Preliminary Summary of the Investigation Movement" and a few articles about economic work, the importance of caring about the interests and improving the lives of the masses. He pointed out that party and Soviet workers must integrate with the masses and delve deeply into them. Only through patient and strenuous work of mobilizing and winning over the masses can the support of the majority of the people be won. During the Anti-Japanese War, our party made a systematic Marxist summary of historical experiences from a theoretical point of view, and the experience of the mass line formed a complete theoretical form. In 1942, Mao Zedong's "Several Questions on Leadership Method" analyzed the whole process and various links of the correct leadership method, such as "from the masses to the masses", "centralized", and "stick to it". During this period, many mass viewpoints were also proposed, such as the viewpoint that the masses are real heroes; that advocating for the interests of the masses is the starting point and destination of Communist Party members revolution; that the opinions and experiences of the masses are the basis for the party to formulate policies; that being responsible to the party and being responsible to the people are consistent viewpoints; the view of learning from the people; the view of serving the people wholeheartedly; and so on. In 1945, the party's Seventh Congress incorporated the basic spirit of the mass line into the party constitution. In the report of amending the party constitution, Liu Shaoqi pointed out that the mass line of the party is "the fundamental political line of our party and also the fundamental organizational line of our party", and clarified the four items contained in the mass viewpoint: everything for the people, everything is responsible to the people, believe that the masses can liberate themselves, and learn from the people.
Whoever wins the hearts of the people will win the world. During the period of the democratic revolution, our party established a close relationship with the people through this mass line, making our strength grow from small to large, from weak to strong, overcoming heavy oppression from domestic and foreign rulers, overthrowing the three mountains, achieving a complete victory in the New Democratic Revolution, and seizing national power. The key to the style of work that is closely connected with the masses lies in the party itself.
In the contradiction between the party and the masses, who is the main aspect of the contradiction? Our party pointed out that the key to strengthening the relationship between the party and the masses lies within the party, in the purity of the party's organization, and in the work of the party. Our party is the leader of the revolution and the embodiment of the people's interests. As long as our party's line, principles, and policies reflect the fundamental interests and requirements of the people, the people will support the leadership of the party and follow the party. On the contrary, if the party's line, principles, and policies are incorrect, and the party's work goes against the interests and requirements of the masses, the people will alienate themselves from the party and form a barrier with the party. It can be seen that in the contradiction between the party and the masses, the party is the main aspect of the contradiction. Starting from improving the party's organization and the party's work, our party has put forward several principles and methods for strengthening the relationship between the party and the masses, enriched the content of the party's fine style of maintaining close contact with the masses, and played a huge role in guiding the construction of the party.
Recognizing the historical status and role of the people from the perspective of the proletarian worldview and then rectifying the relationship between the party and the masses.
"People, only people, are the driving force of creating world history." This is Mao Zedong's incisive elaboration of the basic viewpoint of historical materialism. Zhu De also said: "Only the masses are the heroes who create history.



"It is based on this fundamental viewpoint of historical materialism that the party's mass line and basic mass viewpoint have been formed. These views are: ①All for the sake of the people, wholeheartedly serving the people; ②All responsible to the people, consistent with being responsible to its own leadership organs; ③ The belief in liberating oneself and learning from the people.
Only through such scientific understanding of the position and role of the people in history, and establishing these basic mass viewpoints, can we correctly relate the following: ① The relationship between the party and the masses, i.e., the working class party does not treat the masses as its tool but consciously recognizes itself as the organization of the masses for accomplishing specific historical tasks at a specific historical period. Recognizing this concept about the party means acknowledging the party has no rights over and above the people, and admitting that the party does not have the power to bestow, take responsibility for, or enforce orders on the people. ②The relationship between the individual and the masses, i.e., no one can exist without the masses and nothing can be achieved otherwise; all Communists, no matter how high their positions are, are servants of the people. ③ The relationship between outstanding individuals and the masses, i.e., outstanding individuals can only represent the fundamental interests of the masses, originate from the struggle of the masses, lead the masses, and create history together with the masses. There can never be one who can take over the world by abandoning the masses.
We must keep in mind the party's fundamental purpose and overall tasks are to serve the people wholeheartedly. Mao Zedong reiterated that the Communist Party of China "takes the greatest interests of the broadest people as the starting point", and "all words and actions of the Communists must be in line with the greatest interests of the broadest people, and be endorsed by the majority of the people as the highest standard". Communists "should always think about the people and plan for them, putting the interests of the masses in the first place". They should "serve the people wholeheartedly, never leave the masses; always proceed from the interests of the people, not from the interests of an individual or small group". There are distinctions between partial interests and overall interests, and short-term and long-term interests for the people. The Communists must never look only at the partial interests of the masses and ignore their overall interests; focus only on the immediate interests of the masses, ignoring their long-term interests. Instead, they should be good at uniting them, making partial interests subordinate to overall interests, and immediate interests to long-term interests when contradictions arise. If the party "cannot represent the greatest interests of the broadest people at all times and in all situations, cannot timely propose correct tasks, policies, and work style, cannot stick to the truth, and cannot correct mistakes in a timely manner when mistakes are made, it will deviate from the people". The Communist Party "can become the vanguard and lead the people just because, and only because, it is the wholehearted servant of the people, it reflects the interests and will of the people, and it strives to help the people organize and fight for their own interests and will".
How to truly serve the people wholeheartedly? Our party has summed up a series of discussions in long-term practice.
(1) We must properly address policies and style of work.
The interests of the masses are always reflected through the policies of the party. In order to formulate correct policies and implement them, we must also address the style of work. Mao Zedong viewed the party's policies as "the life of the party", and believed that "policy is the starting point of all practical actions of a revolutionary party, and it is manifest in the process and result of actions". The formulation of the correct policies of the party must go through the process of "from the masses, to the masses". The party's policies also have to be proven right or wrong in the practice of the masses."


All correct policies are in line with the interests and demands of the masses at that time and place, and are connected with the masses. Otherwise, they will not align with the interests and demands of the masses and will be alienated from them. In the process of implementing the Party's policies and completing work tasks, sometimes some behaviours violate the Party's policies and discipline. These behaviors can cause dissatisfaction among the masses towards the Party. Zhu De pointed out that if these violations of policy and discipline are not suitably overcome, it will cause the Party to severely alienate the masses. 

Regarding the issue of style, the bond between the Party and the people can only be strengthened by promoting the correct style and overcoming the poor style. Establishing a theoretical link with reality, maintaining close ties with the masses, and practicing criticism along with self-criticism, are the three excellent styles that our Party has formed in the practice of long-term revolution. They reflect the Party's dialectical materialism and historical materialism's worldview and methodology, demonstrate the correct scientific attitude of communists towards Marxist theory, the masses, and themselves, and are the fundamental guarantee to promote the development of the Party and its cause. In the construction of socialist modernization, we must continue to carry forward these three superior styles of our Party. In overcoming poor style, our Party's leaders have repeatedly stressed the need to oppose dogmatism, empiricism, commandism, tailism, sectarianism, bureaucracy, subjectivism, formalism, and arrogance in work attitude, believing that these malpractices must be reformed, because they will cause harm to the masses' interests and lead to alienation from them.

2) We must adhere to the cognitive route of "from the masses and to the masses."

To formulate correct policies and put them into practice correctly, it is necessary to maintain a close relationship between the Party and the masses and solve the issue of the recognition route. In 1943, Mao Zedong systematically clarified the recognition method and working method of the mass line "from the masses, to the masses". He said: "In all practical work of our Party, any correct leadership must come from the masses and go to the masses. This means gathering the opinions of the masses (dispersed and unsystematic opinions), and after research and understanding, propagating and explaining them to the masses, so that the masses adopt them, put them into action, and test whether these opinions are correct in the course of mass action. Then, we gather them from the masses again, and persist in pushing them among the masses. This endless cycle, each time more correct, more vivid, more rich. This is Marxist epistemology."

"From the masses, to the masses" includes the following basic links: One is "from the masses". From the perspective of cognition, it involves immersing oneself within the masses, understanding the reality, conducting serious investigation, thereby attaining an enriched empirical understanding, and understanding the emotions, will, desires, and experiences created by the masses. The people are the subject of understanding and transforming the world and have rich practical experience. If we do not infiltrate the masses, we cannot get a good understanding and absorb their valuable experiences, hence hindering the ability to make decisions and measures that are suitable for the local conditions and wishes of the local masses. In practical work, many of our cadres subjectively want to serve the people well, but if they do not delve into the masses, understanding the situation, and listening to their opinions, they often end up doing a bad job, causing losses to the masses. The fact proves, regardless of who they are, if they don't go deep into reality, don't go deep into the masses, don't listen to the masses' opinions seriously, they will definitely make big mistakes.

The second is "Gathering the opinions of the masses." This process involves extracting, analyzing, and organizing the empirical knowledge obtained from the masses to construct a systematic and rational understanding, which would form the basis for decision-making and problem-solving. The so-called "gathering" is not merely about stacking up the opinions of the masses. Instead, it requires us to apply the fundamental views of Marxism and its methodologies, sort out scattered opinions and experiences of the masses, and abstract them into systematic and scientific propositions. However, it is possible that some errors might take place during organizing, analyzing, discerning, and abstracting processes. Yet, by continuously consulting with the masses and researching their practices, we can reduce errors and detect and rectify mistakes promptly. The third part is "Going among the masses". This process involves using the masses' practices to assess whether the propositions and policies derived from them are correct and allow for further modification, enrichment, and improvement. In addition to advocating for the party's guidelines and policies and garnering their acceptance and implementation by the masses, it involves obtaining experiences of the masses in implementing these policies, hence examining and modifying these policies. 

Both party members and party cadres should discipline themselves and act as role models. During the revolutionary struggle, Mao Zedong always underscored the crucial role of Communist Party members as pioneers and role models. Zhou Enlai advocated self-discipline and adhered to the practice of "never separating from the masses, learning from them, and assisting them" as his self-cultivation principle and a fundamental requirement for leaders. Chen Yun reiterated the same principle and emphasized that the style of the ruling party directly affects the party's survival. Clearly, the party is a role model for the entire society, and the leaders at all levels are the role models for the party. If the party disregards the opinion and interests of the masses, it cannot expect the masses to trust and respect its leadership. Therefore, our party emphasizes that members and cadres should care about the hardships of the masses, listen to their opinions, and in particular, party leaders need to lead by example, uphold integrity in their public services, and persevere in their struggle against violations of law and discipline.

Section Five: Thoughts on the Party's Leadership
First, the leadership of the Chinese Communist Party is a fundamental guarantee for the victory of the Chinese revolution.
The continuous victories of the Chinese revolution and construction under the leadership of our party are fundamentally due to the scientific theory employed as its ideological weapon. It represents the fundamental interests of all ethnic groups in China; and it has steadily managed to decipher the laws governing the historical development of modern Chinese society. Simultaneously, it is proficient in applying Marxist theories of political party to constantly summarize leadership experience, gradually forming its leadership theory.



The party's leading thought is the scientific worldview and methodology of proletarian leadership. It is a highly creative, distinctly practical, and class-oriented theory system with a rich content and a very complete logic. 
The Chinese people's resistance struggles are extremely brave. In the history of modern China, in order to save the unprecedentedly severe national crisis and social crisis, the Chinese people carried out numerous unyielding struggles, and countless benevolent people tirelessly explored the path to save the country and the people. These struggles and explorations, each time had a certain impact on pushing Chinese society towards progress, but the direct outcome of each time was failure. It is proven that self-strengthening movements and reformism that do not touch the feudal foundation, old peasant wars, democratic revolutions led by the bourgeois revolutionary faction, and other various schemes copying Western capitalism cannot complete the national mission of saving the nation and antifeudal and anti-imperialistic historical tasks. China is looking forward to new social forces in search of advanced theories to open up a new path of revolution.

The great mission of leading the revolutionary struggle against imperialism and feudalism, striving for national independence and people's liberation, and realizing the revitalization of China historically falls on the Chinese Communist Party. After the Chinese Communist Party, as the vanguard of the working class, took to the political stage in China, the Chinese revolution entered the historical stage of the New Democratic Revolution. The Chinese Communist Party, in the practice of long-term struggle, played its political and organizational advantages, and united and condensed the Chinese people, who were viewed as "disparate sand," into an unbeatable force. After 28 years of hard and extraordinary struggle, especially after the Northern Expedition, the Land Revolution War, the War of Resistance Against Japan, and the National Liberation War, the reactionary rule of imperialism, feudalism, and bureaucratic capitalism was finally overthrown, and the great victory of the New Democratic Revolution was achieved. The long-cherished wish of the Chinese people to establish an independent, free, democratic, unified, and prosperous new China was finally realized. The reason why China could make a great historical transformation from the most tragic situation to a bright future is that it has the leadership of the Chinese Communist Party. "Without the Communist Party, there would be no new China." This is the most basic, most important conclusion drawn by the Chinese people based on the historical experience of the Chinese revolution since modern times and is a great truth confirmed by the Chinese people based on their personal experience.

The leading position of the Chinese Communist Party cannot be achieved by any individual's desires or wills alone. After the overthrow of the feudal monarchy by the 1911 Revolution, for a long period of time in the first half of the 20th century, there existed several options for what kind of country China should establish, and various forces were engaged in fierce struggles for this. One was represented by the Beiyang warlords, later by the Nationalist Party ruling group, implementing the dictatorship of the landlord and big bourgeoisie, and letting China continue on the semi-colonial and semi-feudal path. A second option was represented by some middle factions or intermediaries, who dreamt of establishing a bourgeois republic and leading Chinese society towards the independent development of capitalism. The third option was represented by the Chinese Communist Party, to establish a people's republic based on the worker-peasant alliance led by the working class, and to move towards socialism through the New Democracy. These three paths, or these three schemes, were repeatedly tested in the development of Chinese social history. The result was that the first scheme was abandoned by the Chinese people, and the reactionary ruling forces representing this scheme were overthrown. The second scheme did not get the approval of the Chinese people, and most of its representatives later admitted that this scheme could not be implemented in China. Only the third scheme eventually won the support of the broadest masses of the Chinese people, including the national bourgeoisie and its political representatives. The Chinese people accepted the leadership of the Chinese Communist Party and accepted the transition from New Democracy to socialism, which was a solemn historical choice.

The Chinese people accepted the leadership of the Chinese Communist Party, mainly because of the progressiveness of the Chinese Communist Party. Since its establishment, the Chinese Communist Party has represented advanced productive forces and taken the stage of history.



The new democratic revolution led by the party aims to oppose the plunder of China by imperialism, eradicate the exploitation and oppression of the landlord class and the bureaucrat bourgeoisie, change the feudal comprador production relations, and change the corrupt political superstructure built on this economic foundation. It seeks to establish a new political superstructure centered on the people's democratic dictatorship and fundamentally liberate the bound productive forces. From the beginning, the Chinese Communist Party guided with Marxism-Leninism, the most advanced and scientific ideological weapon, and combined it with the actual situation of the Chinese revolution, proposing and developing advanced theories and cultures that can greatly mobilize, inspire, and guide the Chinese people. The Communist Party of China, as the party of the most advanced class in China, represents not only the interests of the working class but also the interests of the Chinese people and the Chinese nation. Throughout the New Democratic Revolution, all the struggles carried out by the party are ultimately for the fundamental interests of the broadest people. The party not only proposed the democratic revolutionary program against imperialism and feudalism but also proposed clear struggle goals and political slogans at every stage of the revolution's development, laying the political foundation for uniting the people of the country to fight together. The party called on all party members to struggle bravely for the victory of the revolution without fear of sacrifice, and with the infinite loyalty and self-sacrifice spirit to the people, many party members created countless heroic deeds that can be sung and wept, setting up a brilliant example of seeking the benefit of the people wholeheartedly, thus winning the trust and support of the Chinese people. The theories, programs, routes, guidelines, policies, and all the work of the party during the New Democratic Revolution period show that the Communist Party of China is indeed at the forefront of the times, representing the development requirements of China's advanced productive forces, the forward direction of advanced culture, and the fundamental interests of the broadest people, and has made the greatest sacrifices for the great revival of the Chinese nation. It is precisely because of this advanced nature that the Chinese people deeply realize that the Communist Party of China is a faithful representative of their interests and will, voluntarily choosing and accepting the leadership of the party, and fighting for the victory of the New Democratic Revolution under the leadership of the party. This shows that the central position and leadership role of the Communist Party of China in the revolutionary cause of the Chinese people are deeply rooted and are unshakeable and unchangeable by any force.
The path that the Communist Party of China has taken in leading the Chinese revolution is extremely tortuous and difficult, and the Chinese people have paid a huge price to win the victory of the revolution and social progress. In this process, the Communist Party of China has accumulated extremely rich experience. Mao Zedong pointed out in summarizing the historical experience of the New Democratic Revolution, "A disciplined party armed with the theoretical weapon of Marxism-Leninism, adopting the method of self-criticism, and connecting with the masses of the people. An army led by such a party. A united front of all revolutionary classes and revolutionary factions led by such a party. These three are our main weapons to defeat the enemy." "With these three, we have achieved basic victory."
Marxism-Leninism, as the guiding ideology of the Communist Party of China, is a scientific theory and methodology for accurately understanding objective reality, with a progressive theoretical trait. Its vitality lies in its close connection with social practice, and it can point the way for people to recognize truth and open the way forward. In the long-term and complex revolutionary struggle, the Communist Party of China, represented mainly by Mao Zedong, overcame the erroneous tendency within the party to mechanically copy the texts of Marxism-Leninism and the experience of other countries. After arduous exploration, it summarized a wealth of original revolutionary practical experience and achieved the first historical leap in the combination of the basic principles of Marxism-Leninism and the actual situation of the Chinese revolution, thereby giving birth to Mao Zedong Thought. This theoretical achievement not only embodies the basic principles of Marxism-Leninism but also includes the excellent ideas of the Chinese nation and the experience summary of the whole party's revolutionary practice.



The Party has closely intertwined the tasks of the national and democratic revolutions, creating the theory and strategy of the New Democratic Revolution, pioneering the unique revolutionary path of surrounding the cities from the countryside and seizing power through armed struggle. The formation and development of Mao Zedong Thought have firmly rooted Marxism-Leninism on Chinese soil. Once this Sinicized Marxism-Leninism is accepted and understood by the Chinese people, it transforms into a powerful material force for revolutionary transformation of Chinese society. The Chinese Communist Party was able to lead the Chinese revolution to victory because it adhered to the correct direction of combining the basic principles of Marxism-Leninism with the actual conditions of the Chinese revolution, good at grasping changes in objective conditions and summarizing the practical experience of the masses, adhering to liberating thinking, and seeking truth from facts, and tirelessly pursuing its own path. This is the most fundamental experience summed up from the history of the Party.

The Chinese Communist Party is the faithful representative of the fundamental interests of the vast majority of the Chinese people. Adhering to the fundamental principle of serving the people wholeheartedly and maintaining close ties with the masses is the fundamental condition for the Chinese Communist Party to overcome various difficulties and succeed in the New Democratic Revolution. Throughout the struggle for national independence and people's liberation, the Party has always relied closely on the masses, seeking the interests of the people sincerely. In all its activities, the Party breathes with the masses, shares the same destiny, always takes reflecting the will and interests of the masses as the starting point and destination of all work, always draws from the wisdom and power of the masses to push forward the revolutionary cause, and gradually forms a set of mass lines about believing in the masses, relying on the masses, coming from the masses, and going to the masses. The Party uses this leadership and working method of the mass line to ensure that the Party's programs, policies, guidelines, and policies are formulated and implemented to best meet the demands of the masses, gain their support, and constantly improve the masses' revolutionary enthusiasm and creativity. This is an important guarantee for the Party's continuous victories.

The Chinese Communist Party must play the advanced role of a proletarian party, lead the people in winning the victory of the Chinese revolution, and also strengthen its own construction, constantly enhancing the Party's creativity, cohesion, and combat effectiveness. The Chinese Communist Party is the result of the combination of Marxism-Leninism and the Chinese worker movement, and the growth and strength of the working class is the fundamental condition for the founding of the Party. However, under Chinese social conditions, the vast majority of Party members come from peasants and other laborers, and many also come from intellectuals, as well as revolutionaries from the non-laboring classes. At the same time, the Party has long been in the environment of rural revolutionary bases. According to these characteristics, the Party regards its own construction as a great project, attaches great importance to the ideological construction, organizational construction, and style construction of the Party, and successfully solves the fundamental problem of maintaining the vanguard nature of the working class and building a Marxist-Leninist party. Through regular Marxist-Leninist ideological education and criticism and self-criticism, summarizing experience and party rectification, the Party can overcome subjectivism, sectism, and political "left" and right errors, learn from errors and failures, make progress, and gradually mature. The Party has cultivated and formed the good styles of combining theory with practice, closely linking with the masses, and self-criticism during long-term struggle, and regards these three styles as distinct from any other political party, emphasizing the importance of adhering to and carrying forward the party's good styles for the realization of the party's political tasks. After long periods of revolutionary fire and repeated tempering, the Party's organization has continuously developed and grown, from a party with only 51 members at the beginning to a mass Marxist-Leninist party with more than 4.48 million members nationwide in September 1949. The Chinese Communist Party is the most advanced and powerful leading force to ensure the victory of the Chinese revolution.



II. Basic Conditions for Implementing Party Leadership

Liu Shaoqi pointed out: The party's mass line is the path to establish the correct relationship between the party and the masses. It is about leading the masses with the correct attitude and method, and is about establishing a proper relationship between the party's leadership and the masses being led. This pointedly defines the essence of Marxist leadership science. Marxists believe that only the people are the real heroes, and only they can liberate themselves. The responsibility and role of leaders can only be to understand the demands of the masses, concentrate the wisdom of the masses, propose slogans and plans that reflect the fundamental interests of the masses; to inspire the consciousness of the masses, so they can recognize their own interests; guide the masses to organize and fight for their own interests; and summarize the experiences of mass struggles, directing the enthusiasm of the masses towards a higher stage. In this process, the main and fundamental force is the masses, and the role played by leaders is both that of a mentor and a student. Moreover, if one does not first and always focus on being a good student of the masses, one is not qualified to be a mentor to them.

Proletarian leaders never use the people as their tools, but consciously regard themselves as tools for the people to achieve their specific historical tasks. The ability to lead the people lies in being a wholehearted servant of the people. In a broad sense, this means serving the vast majority of the people; in a direct sense, this means serving those who are led. Leadership is service, this is the fundamental position of the proletariat to correctly understand and handle the relationship between leadership and the masses. From this standpoint, Mao Zedong repeatedly emphasized the need to closely link concern for the people's livelihood with the realization of the party's political tasks, to provide the masses with visible material benefits or at least not harm their interests as one of the fundamental conditions for leadership, and to act in the best interests of the vast majority of people, supported by them, as the highest standard for all communists' words and actions.

Therefore, whether or not one can gain the support of the masses and attain leadership qualifications, the first issue to resolve is the problem of ideas and concepts. Only by firmly standing on the side of the masses can policies, approaches, and methods that fundamentally represent the interests of the masses be generated. If one stands from the standpoint of individuals or small groups, treating the masses as tools for realizing personal or small group interests, one would ultimately stand against the masses and necessarily determine and adopt policies, approaches, and methods from the perspective of how to drive and control the masses. This is incompatible with the science of Marxist leadership. Our party repeatedly emphasizes that such leaders will definitely be abandoned by the masses.

Leadership presupposes the possession of certain power. In the practice of leading the people in revolutionary struggles, our party points out that it is very important to fully understand, both theoretically and ideologically, where power comes from. Exploiting ruling classes either believe power is god-given, or acquired through "personal struggle", always treating it as a privilege entirely belonging to themselves and superior to the masses. Guided by this view of power, even the most enlightened political opinions merely advocate "ruling for the people". The ruler is still themselves, not the people. In contrast to this view, our party believes that only the people are the true masters of society, and leaders merely serve as public servants who implement tasks in accordance with the will of the people.


The power in their hands is granted by the people. It is not the leaders deciding on behalf of the people, but the people themselves rule their own lives. The masses' obedience to power is their obedience to their collective will. If leaders misuse their power against the will of the people, the people can take back their power at any time and dismiss them. Under the guidance of two different viewpoints of power, the use of power will not only result in completely opposite impacts on the interests of the masses but also create leaders with vastly different positions, abilities, characters, and styles.

Who are the creators of history? Who are they serving? Who does power belong to? In summary, it's about who is the subject of history. The vast masses of people represent the advanced productive forces and the historical direction of society. Therefore, only they are the subjects of history. Upon deeply understanding this social and historical truth, leaders will consciously position themselves as public servants and conscientiously fulfill their duties.

Thirdly, the basic laws of our Party's leadership activities

Our Party, with the mass views of Marxism as the theoretical basis, analyses from an epistemological level the significant meaning of proper leadership, through summarizing the experiences of Party-led revolutionary struggles. It emphasizes the need to adhere to the "from the masses, to the masses" and "consolidate and persist" methods, to avoid being divorced from reality and the masses, overcome subjectivism, bureaucratism, and commandism, fully stimulate and mobilize the people's consciousness, positivity, and creativity, ensuring that leaders make correct decisions and put them into practice smoothly. The ideological foundation of this leadership method is to seek truth from facts; the organizational assurance is democratic centralism. The close integration of seeking truth from facts, mass line, and democratic centralism reveals the essential characteristics of various leadership methods in proletariat's activities of cognition and world reformation, embodying the most basic leadership laws.

Seeking truth from facts is the only correct ideological route that guides leaders to make scientific decisions and correct mistakes. Our Party emphasizes that all work is dependent on seeking truth from facts, but the difficulty also lies in it. The key to solving this problem lies in closely linking seeking truth from facts and the mass-line approach so that both can benefit each other. Seeking truth from facts is the prerequisite for adhering to the mass-line approach. When Mao Zedong solved the problem of leadership methods, he started from solving the thinking methods of the leaders, washing away the spiritual idealism. He first proposed that "the victory of the Chinese revolution depends on Chinese comrades understanding the Chinese situation," and reiterated the basic leadership slogans: "no investigation, no right to speak," "no correct survey, likewise no right to speak," thus making seeking truth from facts, investigation, and the mass-line approach become the guidelines for all Party cadres' thoughts and actions, realizing the first element of correct leadership. Again, seeking truth from facts must be based on the mass-line approach. The most basic channel to understand reality is to conduct research on the masses all real knowledge could only come from the masses engaged directly in various practical activities. If leaders don't learn humbly from the masses or personally conduct in-depth investigation among the masses and make assumptions, make decisions, express opinions and solve problems, they're bound to make mistakes. Because connecting with reality and the masses is so important and inseparable, to practice scientific leadership, we must start by learning from the practice of the masses. In 1930, Mao Zedong pointed out that by living solely from books, divorced from mass practice, one not only fell into opportunism or impulsivity but also risked veering onto the road of counter-revolution.


The mass line is the fundamental guarantee to achieve the leadership's intention. Correct decisions that come from the masses can only be realized if they are persevered with among the masses. Without the close combination of leadership enthusiasm and mass enthusiasm, it is impossible to accomplish any major tasks. Therefore, believing in the masses and believing in the party, are the two inseparable fundamental principles that our party and people have persisted in for a long time, and are the basic basis for doing a good job in leadership work. The more setbacks, pressures, and difficulties encountered in work, the more emphasis should be placed on these two principles. In the practice of revolution, some people believe in foreign forces more than in their own party and people, or they antagonize the party and the masses, and as a result, they always cause a lot of trouble. Therefore, our party emphasizes that leaders at all levels must go deep into the grassroots, into the masses, and work solidly to implement the party's line, principles, and policies. This is the correct way to follow leadership laws, improve leadership work, and raise leadership standards.

Democratic centralism, as the fundamental organizational principle of the party and the state system, is the embodiment of the mass line in the life of the party and the political life of the state. Collective leadership, the principle of minority compliance with the majority, and other fundamental principles and systems of democratic centralism are all based on trust and reliance on the wisdom and strength of the masses. If leaders believe in themselves more than in the masses, they will tend toward personal dictatorship; if they trust a minority around them more than the masses, it can lead to sectarianism. Both would destroy democratic centralism and undermine the enthusiasm of the masses. Democratic centralism is also the organizational guarantee for adhering to the leadership method of the mass line. It comes from the masses, and it integrates the opinions of the masses. It can only be concentrated on the majority's opinions according to the principles and procedures of democratic centralism; to go to the masses, action is needed, with the necessary authority to ensure it, and this authority can only be established on the basis of democratic centralism. As Liu Shaoqi pointed out in his work report at the Party's Seventh Congress, democratic centralism is the organizational law of the Party, and the correct organizational line is the mass line. This profoundly illustrates that adhering to democratic centralism is an objective requirement of the leadership law.

IV. Basic Methods of the Party's Leadership Work
In the process of leading the people to strive for national liberation, our party deeply explored the laws of leadership work and initially formed a set of effective leadership work methods.
Firstly, leadership work should focus on the center while taking other aspects into account. The party has different central tasks at different stages of historical development, and all the work of the party should revolve around this central task. Therefore, the leader of a region or a unit must place various tasks in an appropriate position, carrying them out in an orderly and rhythmic manner, much like playing the piano.



Firstly, it is important to distinguish between central work and routine work. Central work and routine work are interconnected but different, with routine work serving as the foundation upon which central work can spur routine work. While focusing primarily on central work, routine work should also be taken into account. If regular work is forgotten, and there is no grasp of actualities, one will become a naive politician. If regular work is not integrated with the party's central work, one can turn into a blind bureaucrat. Only by skillfully linking regular work with the party's central work and struggle goals in a certain period can one become a politically astute revolutionary with the party's leadership being fruitful. Secondly, one must correctly handle the relationship between the whole and the parts, with work being mainly centered and achieving consistency between the whole and the parts. Leaders must be skilled at distinguishing between urgent and non-urgent tasks, differentiating between primary and secondary work, central and routine work, ensuring key points while taking care of others, striving to align the parts with the whole. 

Secondly, the central issue in leadership style is handling the relationship between superiors and subordinates correctly. Our party points out that superiors and subordinates should trust each other on the basis of safeguarding the interests of the party and the people, which is an important condition for improving the relationship between superiors and subordinates. Superiors lead subordinates, but the basic attitude is to help subordinates and improve leadership by learning from subordinates' experiences, which is the key to improving the superior-subordinate relationship. The key to mutual trust and respect between superiors and subordinates is that superiors should be humble in learning from subordinates, absorbing and summarizing subordinates' experiences, while also passionately helping subordinates, enhancing their enthusiasm and creativity, strengthening their sense of mission and responsibility, and improving their policy level and work ability. Mao Zedong once said that the responsibility of leaders, in summary, mainly involves giving ideas and using cadres. Chen Yun also pointed out that leadership organs decide on plans. Implementing plans and checking the work must be subjective and objective. Only by conducting in-depth actual investigations and research, listening to the experiences and opinions of subordinates, and finally forming resolutions or tasks, can one conform to reality and withstand the test of practice. At the same time, superiors should help subordinates correctly execute resolutions or tasks and check the results of the execution. For new problems emerging in actual work, concrete analysis and handling is necessary, therefore, policy formulation and task assignment should be flexible, allowing subordinates to act according to actual conditions. Once the work tasks are clear, corresponding measures should be proposed, and concrete and realistic guidance should be given to subordinates to ensure the smooth and successful completion of tasks. In the process of leadership and leadership, our party emphasizes that superior leaders should be brave in criticizing themselves and daring to take responsibility, which is an effective way to resolve contradictions between superiors and subordinates and improve their relationship.

Thirdly, fully mobilizing the masses is key to undertaking all work. The masses are the basis upon which the party relies for existence, consolidation, and development, and are the sole source of the party's strength. At the same time, the party is also the tool used by the masses in their liberation struggle. Therefore, our party points out that party work should start with the urgent problems that the masses demand to be solved, which is a key to effective leadership. Caring about the lives of the masses and paying attention to their immediate interests is an important link to fully mobilize the masses and achieve effective leadership of the party; being good at linking the party's slogans, propositions, and policies with the immediate interests of the masses constitutes the main content of the party's leadership.



Fourthly, we need to apply various working methods flexibly according to specific situations. To effectively implement the party's line, principles, policies, and the spirit of higher authorities' instructions, we must pay attention to leadership artistry. We must adopt flexible and diverse working methods according to the different situations in different regions. Chen Yun pointed out that all working methods must be determined according to the different circumstances of each locality. General principles and methods can refer to the various resolutions of the central government, and at the same time, conscientiously combine with the actual situation of the localities at that time to propose appropriate slogans and flexibly apply various working methods. Formulating a working policy based on the actual situation is the most fundamental thought method and working method that all Communists must remember. Implementing the party's line, principles, policies, and the spirit of the instructions of superiors must be combined with the actual situation. It is necessary to study new situations, solve new problems, summarise new experiences, open up new situations, and creatively implement and carry out in practical work to push forward the business of revolution and construction. There are two wrong tendencies to be opposed here: one is to refuse to enforce on the pretext of special circumstances, the other is to enforce blindly regardless of the actual situation in the locality. If the resolutions or instructions of superior entities are blindly followed and applied mechanically without considering the actual situation of the locality, it is not a good working method, but opposition to the resolutions and instructions of superiors. As Mao Zedong pointed out sternly and sharply in the article "Opposing Bookworshipping", blindly enforcing the instructions of superiors without dissent on the surface is not really enforcing the instructions of superiors. This is the most subtle way to oppose or slack off the directives of superiors.

Fifth, the Correct Style of the Party's Leadership
Leadership style is intrinsically linked to the nature of leadership and is an external manifestation of a leader's position and world view. Mao Zedong particularly mentioned at the Seventh National Congress of the Party that it is a new working style created by the party armed with Marxist-Leninist theory and the Chinese people. It is a distinctive feature that distinguishes Communists from any other parties. Our party emphasises that to implement the correct leadership style, we must first pay attention to the differences from the leadership style of other classes and it must be based on theoretical advancement and closely linked to the masses. Our party points out that how to treat the masses is firstly a matter of position, purpose, and feelings for proletarian leaders. Sincerely regarding oneself as an ordinary member among the masses, starting from the attitude of respecting and loving the masses, and serving the people wholeheartedly, would consciously form and adhere to a good style. Without fundamentally changing one's worldview and emotional stance, focusing merely on the method can only maintain a superficial relationship with the people. Once the consciousness of being an official overcomes the concept of masses, various forms of wrong styles that deviate from the masses will arise, and the leader's image will change from "public servant" to "old master". This will result in loss of leadership authority and the difficulty of effective implementation of leadership.

The application of theory to reality is a key expression of leaders overcoming subjectivity and adhering to the proletarian party spirit. It requires leaders to have a solid theoretical foundation, a genuine understanding of reality, and adhere to specific analyses of specific issues. It demands truth and facts, striving to unify Marxist-Leninist principles, Mao Zedong Thought, the spirit of superior instructions, with the specific realities of local areas and departments, and creatively solve problems. It is also important to daringly think, act and follow a path not taken by predecessors; however, it is equally essential to ensure that thoughts and actions comply with objective laws and stand up to the test of practice. Our party emphasises that to achieve correct leadership, we must further promote this tradition.



Maintaining the closest connection with the broadest masses of the people is the source of wisdom and strength for the proletarian leaders, and the fundamental guarantee to maintain the nature of the "people's servant". It requires leaders to always understand the wishes of the masses, grasp the pulse of the masses, care about the suffering of the masses, and learn from the experiences of the masses. In terms of thinking, they should stand taller, see farther, and timely propose tasks that the masses need and can be resolved. In action, they should insist on moving forward with the majority of the masses. When most people are aware, quickly and decisively organize the masses to act; when most people are not yet aware, they should wait patiently and be good at inspiring. Their style should be modest and cautious, treating people as equals. Their life should be hard and simple, without any special treatment. In conclusion, they must not be detached from the masses, and they must not be superior to the masses.
Having the courage to carry out criticism and self-criticism, to carry out positive ideological struggle, to uphold the truth and correct mistakes, is an important manifestation of bearing the responsibility to the people. Our party believes that for us communists, starting from serving the best interests of the widest range of people, leaders should work humbly and impetuously for the benefit of the people, tell the truth, not save face, and treat shortcomings and mistakes in leadership work, whether they come from oneself or from other aspects, they should all receive serious and not perfunctory criticism and self-criticism and correct them in earnest. If one is arrogant, domineering, only saving face, covering the truth, or blaming failures and frustrations on the led, complaining about the backwardness of the masses, and even insisting on errors, that would inevitably lose the trust of the masses and become a loner.
Chapter on the Establishment of Mao Zedong Thought's Guiding Status Mao Zedong Thought's Guiding Position
Section I: The Whole Party's Understanding and Acceptance of Mao Zedong Thought
1. The Proposal of the Concept of "Mao Zedong Thought"
Since its inception, the Chinese Communist Party has affirmed the guiding position of Marxism. The gradual combination of Marxism with the practice of the Chinese revolution gave birth to Sinicized Marxism. As Mao Zedong was the main pioneer of Sinicism of Marxism and the main founder of the theoretical system of Sinicized Marxism, the Chinese communists named this theoretical innovation that carries Chinese characteristics as "Mao Zedong Thought". Mao Zedong Thought "came to maturity in the late period of the Agrarian Revolutionary War and during the period of the War of Resistance Against Japan through a systematic summary and multi-faceted development," The concept of "Mao Zedong Thought" is an acknowledgment and theoretical generalization of this historical fact. 
Just as the process from Mao Zedong Thought's inception to its maturity went through a long exploration, the emergence of the "Mao Zedong Thought" concept and its becoming the consensus of the whole Party also went through a considerable period. After the 1935 Zunyi Conference which actually established Mao's leadership position in the party, the Chinese communist party's ability to handle China's revolution independently became increasingly stronger. With the outbreak of the Anti-Japanese War, the party successfully transitioned from the civil revolutionary war to the Anti-Japanese National War, and Mao's leadership position was not only consolidated within the Chinese Communist Party, but was also recognized by the Communist International.



In September 1938, at the successive meetings of the Central Political Bureau and the Sixth Plenary Session of the Sixth Party Congress, Wang Jiaxiang, who returned to China from Moscow, conveyed the opinions of Comintern and Dimitrov affirming the correctness of the CCP's line and Mao Zedong's leadership position. The Comintern pointed out: since the resistance against Japan, "the political line of the CCP is correct, the CCP has truly applied Marxism-Leninism under complex conditions and difficult conditions." It also specifically pointed out: the problems that occur in the leadership, "it should be resolved under the leadership of Mao Zedong, and there should be a close unity in the leadership." These opinions of the Communist International have greatly promoted the whole party to further carry forward the innovative spirit under the leadership of Mao Zedong, and apply Marxism-Leninism to solve the problem of the Chinese revolution, which has also inevitably pushed forward the attention and research of the whole party to Mao Zedong's theoretical contribution.

Not long after the publication of "On New Democracy", there was a phrase in the party, "Comrade Mao Zedong's theory." In early May 1940, at the opening ceremony of Yan'an "Zedong Youth Cadre School", Wang Ming, then Secretary of the Central Secretariat, was invited to give a lecture on "Study Mao Zedong." He praised Mao Zedong as not only "the great politician and strategist of the Chinese Revolution," but also "a great theorist," calling for "learning Comrade Mao Zedong's lifetime career and theory." He also spoke from "constructing Soviet power", "constructing the Chinese Red Army of Workers and Peasants," "creating revolutionary military strategy tactics," "establishing a national united front," "establishing a new democratic power". These five aspects illustrate Mao Zedong's "spirit of creation." This is a preliminary summary of Mao Zedong's theoretical contribution. Wang Ming specifically mentioned "On New Democracy", saying that this work is a new contribution to Marxism-Leninism on the issue of the state. Although from Wang Ming's later statements and actions, his praise for Mao Zedong and Mao Zedong's theoretical contribution may not be sincere, but because of his study abroad background and status, this speech still has a considerable impact.

The party's theoretical workers have played an important role in promoting the theoretical contribution of Mao Zedong. Ai Siqi published an article in February 1940, pointed out: On the basis of practice, China "has already produced some theories to develop Marxism, so it has its own Marxism." This judgment has played a leading role in proposing the concept of "Chinese Marxism" and "Mao Zedong Thought". From March 1941 to February 1942, Zhang Ruixin's many articles proposed a series of important views and judgments. He first used the concept of "Comrade Mao Zedong's Thought," "Mao Zedong's theoretical and tactical system," "Mao Zedong Marxism," etc., pointing out: Mao Zedong's speeches and works are "the best embodiment of the sinicization of Marxism-Leninism", "Comrade Mao Zedong The theory is Chinese Marxism-Leninism", and it should "study how Comrade Mao Zedong applies the basic principles of Marxism-Leninism to the Chinese environment, and how to develop creative Marxism." He contributed to Mao Zedong's innovation and development of Marxism from different angles...or divided into four aspects: the social and class relations of Chinese society and the characteristics of the Chinese national democratic revolution, the national united front, the Chinese national democratic revolution The construction of power, the construction of revolutionary armies and bases, and the strategy and tactics of revolutionary wars; or divided into three aspects: ideological lines or methodology, political lines or political science, military lines or military science, and discussed it. Deng Tuo wrote an editorial for the Jinchaji Daily on July 1, 1942, titled "Commemorating July 1 and Learning to Master Mao Zedong Thought": "The Chinese Communist Party has nationalized and sinicized Marxism-Leninism in 21 years of struggle. The sinicization of Marxism-Leninism is Mao Zedong's Thought." "Mao Zedong's Marxism, is Chinese Marxism-Leninism, and every Chinese Marxist-Leninist, in fact, must and can only be a Maoist."

This article, like Zhang Ruxin's, categorizes Mao Zedong's theoretical contributions into three parts: scientific thinking methods, political science theory, military science theory and strategy. But it emphasizes, "The policy of concretizing, nationalizing, and sinicizing Marxism is the most essential feature of Comrade Mao Zedong's thinking methods." Following this, Deng Tuo also used the term "Comrade Mao Zedong's doctrine." Besides, Hu Qiaomu, Chen Boda, Tao Zhu, Lu Dingyi, Hua Gang, and others used Mao Zedong's basic theories and research methods in their works to analyze and solve problems, reflecting from one side that the theoretical circle recognized Mao Zedong's contributions.

With the Rectification Movement, the entire party’s understanding of Mao Zedong's contributions to the Sinicization of Marxism was advancing. This is highlighted by many senior leaders publishing articles to express their opinions. On July 1, 1942, Zhu De, in his article, "Commemorating the 21st Anniversary of the Party," used the concept of "Sinicized Marxism-Leninism" and said, "Today, our party has accumulated rich experience in struggle, correctly grasped the theory of Marxism-Leninism, and in the practice of the Chinese revolution, we have created the theory of Sinicized Marxism-Leninism to guide the Chinese revolution."

On the same day, Chen Yi pointed out at the 21st anniversary celebration of the New Fourth Army: Mao Zedong "advocates a scientific mind and scientific methods to deal with the problem of Sinicization of Marxism and Leninism," creating a "correct ideological system." He categorized Mao Zedong's theory on Chinese revolution into five aspects: the social nature of China, the revolutionary power, its future, and the corresponding problems of revolutionary strategy and tactics; the organization and leadership of revolutionary wars; the theory and construction of Soviet power; the issue of building the Party; and the correct thinking method, dealing with Western European academia and Chinese national traditional academic thoughts transformation.

In June 1943, Ren Bishi wrote that one of the fundamental reasons why Mao Zedong was able to "concretize and sinicize Marxism-Leninism" is his "strong concept of the masses and his attitude of humbly learning from the masses," which is the biggest feature of Mao Zedong's "thinking method and working method." We need to study Marxism-Leninism, especially Sinicized Marxism-Leninism. 

On July 6, 1943, Liu Shaoqi used the concepts of "Comrade Mao Zedong's thought" and "Comrade Mao Zedong's ideological system" in his article, "Clearing up Menshevik Thoughts in the Party." On July 8, 1943, Wang Jiaxiang's article, "The Chinese Communist Party and the Road of Chinese National Liberation," not only used the term "Mao Zedong Thought," which has been used ever since, but also discussed the "growth, development, and maturation" process of Mao Zedong's thought, clearly stating that "Mao Zedong Thought is Chinese Marxism-Leninism, Chinese Bolshevism, Chinese Communism." It is the creative Marxism-Leninism, and it is the development of Marxism-Leninism in China.

On August 2, 1943, Zhou Enlai made a speech at the welcome party organized by Central Office for him, stating that the Party's 22-year history shows that "Comrade Mao Zedong's opinion has run through the entire historical period of the Party and has developed into a path of Sinicizing Marxism-Leninism, which is the line of Chinese Communism"! Communism, after being used and developed by Mao Zedong, has taken root in Chinese soil. On November 10, 1943, Deng Xiaoping gave a speech at the Rectification Mobilization Meeting of the Northern Bureau Party School, pointing out that after the Zunyi Meeting, the Party's cause was completely under the guidance of "Sinicized Marxism-Leninism, i.e., Mao Zedong Thought."

The above shows that, with the continuous accumulation of revolutionary experience, the publication of a series of important works by Mao Zedong, the development of the Party-wide Rectification Movement, especially the discussion of historical issues by senior Party leaders, the Party not only reached a consensus on Mao Zedong's development of Marxism-Leninism, but also found the scientific statement to summarize the achievements of Sinicized Marxism— "Mao Zedong Thought," and made a preliminary summary of its basic content.



During that time, there were various terminologies such as "Comrade Mao Zedong's Theory", "Comrade Mao Zedong's Doctrine", "Mao Zedong Thought", etc. After selection, the Central Committee made a "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues", which was unified at the Seventh Party Congress. On April 20, 1945, the "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues" (hereinafter referred to as the "Resolution"), which was basically passed by the Seventh Plenary Session of the Sixth Central Committee, was a theoretical achievement of senior leaders discussing the history of the party during the Rectification Movement. It is a historic resolution that fully affirmed Mao Zedong's historical status and established Mao Zedong Thought as the guiding thought of the entire party.
The "Resolution" summarized the historical experiences since the establishment of the Communist Party and summarized several major historical issues. It critically criticized the erroneous tendency of dogmatizing Marxism and sacralizing the resolution of the Comintern and Soviet experience that appeared within the party during the period of the Agrarian Revolutionary War, and revealed the political, military, organizational, and ideological manifestations and their social and ideological roots of various "left" errors. At the same time, it highly praised Mao Zedong's outstanding contribution to solving China's revolution problem using Marxism-Leninism, affirming the important significance of establishing Mao Zedong's leadership position within the entire party. The draft of the "Resolution" approved by the Seventh Plenary Session of the Sixth Central Committee of the Party pointed out: "In the twenty-five years, the Party has produced its own leader, Comrade Mao Zedong, and has formed a correct line and thought distinct from all erroneous lines and thoughts -– Mao Zedong's line and Mao Zedong's thought." This is the first time the concept of "Mao Zedong Thought" is officially used in party documents. The "Resolution" discussed the basic content of Mao Zedong Thought from political, military, organizational, and ideological perspectives, expounding how Mao Zedong used Marxist positions, viewpoints, and methods to propose a set of theories, lines, principles, and policies needed for the Chinese revolution. The "Resolution" emphasized that the task of the entire party in the future is to "unite all comrades of the party like a harmonious family and a solid piece of iron on the basis of compliance with Marxist-Leninist thought, and strive for the complete victory of the anti-Japanese war and the complete liberation of the Chinese people".
The convening of the Seventh Plenary Session of the Sixth Central Committee of the Party and the adoption of the "Resolution" signaled the victorious conclusion of the Rectification Movement, strengthened the unity of the entire party on the basis of Mao Zedong Thought, and mentally prepared for the opening of the Seventh Party Congress and the incorporation of the guiding position of Mao Zedong Thought into the party constitution.
Secondly, the establishment of the guiding position of Mao Zedong Thought The Seventh Party Congress held from April 23 to June 11, 1945, occupies a particularly important position in the historical process of sinicization of Marxism. On the one hand, it pushed forward the theory of the Party's revolutionary nation-building; on the other hand, it systematically summarized the achievements already made in the sinicization of Marxism and clearly defined the guiding position of Mao Zedong Thought.
Mao Zedong's written and oral political reports and conclusions for the conference further enriched the theoretical content of the New Democratic Revolution.
Firstly, the total line of the New Democratic Revolution, namely "the anti-imperialist and anti-feudal revolution led by the proletariat," is fully explained. Mao Zedong said, "Our line, our program, summarized in one sentence, is the 'anti-imperialist and anti-feudal revolution of the people led by the proletariat'. This is the New Democratic Revolution. This line involves a team issue, an enemy issue, and also a leader and commander issue of the team." He particularly emphasized the important position of peasants in the Chinese Revolution, pointing out that peasants are the "most important part of the people," "the main force of the Chinese Democratic Revolution," "Without the peasants, there is no Chinese Democratic Revolution; without the Chinese Democratic Revolution, there is no Chinese Socialist Revolution, and there is no revolution at all," "The proletariat should mainly lead the peasants".
Secondly, the political, economic, and cultural programs of the New Democracy were further concretized, and new content was added.



Mao Zedong not only distinguished the highest and lowest programs of the party, but also for the first time distinguished the general and specific programs of the party during the Democratic Revolution. The general program is to advocate "establishing a national system of democratic alliances based on an absolute majority of the people", that is, "the national system of New Democracy".Under this national system, there are practices of New Democratic politics, New Democratic economics, and New Democratic culture. Among them, Mao Zedong particularly mentioned the "broad development of capitalism". He explained that the difference between this report and "On New Democracy" is that it determines the need for large-scale development of capitalism, and opposes autocracy first.

"Why do Communists not only not fear capitalism, but advocate its development?" It's because, "Replacing the oppression of foreign imperialism and the country's feudalism with the development of capitalism is not only a progress, but also an inevitable process. It benefits not only the bourgeoisie but also the proletariat. Nowadays, China has an extra foreign imperialism and a national feudalism, but not enough national capitalism. On the contrary, we lack capitalism." Of course, the capitalist development mentioned here is the capitalism that "cannot manipulate the livelihood of the people" and "New Democratic Capitalism". Mao Zedong pointed out that such a proposition clearly distinguishes it from "populism". As for the specific program, Mao Zedong listed 40 items, including: eliminating Japanese invaders and prohibiting midway compromise; abolishing the one-party dictatorship of the Kuomintang and establishing a democratic coalition government; carrying out land reforms and liberating farmers; developing industries and fighting for China's industrialization and modernization of agriculture; cultivating, uniting and educating intellectuals, and developing cultural and educational undertakings.To develop industry, Mao Zedong also stated: Foreign investments are welcome under the conditions of obeying Chinese laws and benefiting Chinese economy.

Third, he proposed the viewpoint of judging the historical role of political parties by production standards. Mao Zedong pointed out, “The goodness, badness, magnitude, and minor of all Chinese parties' policies and their performance in the Chinese people ultimately depend on whether they are helpful to the development of the Chinese people's productive forces and their size. Does it bind or liberate productive forces?” All the programs of the Communist Party of China are to liberate and develop China's social productive forces and build China into an independent, free, democratic, unified and prosperous country, which is why they are welcomed by the Chinese people.

In addition, in Mao Zedong's political report and Zhu De's military report on "On Liberation War", Liu Shaoqi's "Report on the Revision of the Party Constitution" and Zhou Enlai's "On the United Front", the Party’s military line composed of People's Army, People's War, and the strategic tactics of People's War, the party-building line emphasizing ideological and political construction while paying attention to organizational construction, and the principles of the Party’s mass line, good style, and democratic centralism, as well as the experience and lessons of the party on the united front issue since the period of the Great Revolution have all been fully elaborated. The Seventh Congress of the Party has added many new contents to the Sinicization of Marxism.

The Seventh Congress of the Party systematically summarized the fruitful achievements of the Sinicization of Marxism and formally established the guiding status of Mao Zedong's thoughts. This is an important aspect of the Seventh Congress of the Party advancing the cause of the Sinicization of Marxism. The contributions in this regard are mainly reflected in Liu Shaoqi's "Report on the Revision of the Party Constitution" and the new party constitution subsequently passed by the Congress.

Liu Shaoqi's report sums up the understanding of the whole party, and systematically and comprehensively summarizes and interprets Mao Zedong's thoughts, which embodies the first historical leap and its achievements of the Sinicization of Marxism.



First, the report elaborates on the complexity of the sinicization of Marxism and the reasons why Mao Zedong could successfully sinicize Marxism. Liu Shaoqi pointed out that due to the great specificity of China's social and historical development, and the underdevelopment of science in China, to systematically sinicize Marxism and to transform it from the European form to the Chinese form means to apply the Marxian positions and methods to solve all kinds of problems in the modern Chinese revolution, including many problems that foreign Marxists have never raised and solved, which is a special and difficult business. This cannot be accomplished by merely studying, reciting and quoting the works of Marxists, but requires a high degree of scientific spirit combined with a high degree of revolutionary spirit. It requires extensive knowledge of history and society, experience in revolutionary struggles, an indomitable spirit for the people's cause, the ability to apply the methods of Marxism to make precise scientific analysis of objective situations, and the ability to gather the experiences, will, and thoughts of the masses and apply them to the masses. It is only by doing so that one can make independent and brilliant contributions to Marxism in relation with Chinese reality and express it in Chinese language form, making it a weapon for guiding the struggle of the Chinese people. "It is our comrade Mao Zedong who has successfully carried out this special and difficult work of sinicization of Marxism." Why is this so? This is because Mao Zedong is not only "the greatest revolutionary and politician in Chinese history", who dares and is able to lead the whole party and the people in earth-shattering struggles, but also "the greatest theorist and scientist in Chinese history", "with the highest theoretical cultivation and the greatest theoretical courage", daring to make bold theoretical creations, "abandoning some of the outdated principles and conclusions in Marxist theory that are unsuitable for the specific environment of China, and replacing them with new principles and conclusions suitable for the historical environment of China". In other words, Mao Zedong possesses all the internal conditions for theoretical innovation, which is why he has successfully carried out the difficult task of sinicization of Marxism.

Second, the report defines the concept of Mao Zedong Thought from multiple angles, revealing its rich connotation and essential characteristics. The first is to define it from the internal relationship between Mao Zedong Thought and Marxism, pointing out that "Mao Zedong Thought is the thought of the unity of Marxist-Leninist theory and the practice of the Chinese revolution, it is Chinese communism, Chinese Marxism". "It is Chinese, yet completely Marxist." The second is to define it from the perspective of applying Marxism's requirements for timeliness and nationality, pointing out that "Mao Zedong Thought is the continuation of Marxism in the current era of colonial, semi-colonial, semi-feudal countries' national democratic revolution, it is an excellent example of the localization of Marxism". The third is to define it from its functional role in guiding the Chinese revolution, pointing out that Mao Zedong Thought is "the outstanding, complete, and correct theory of our nation about the Chinese people's revolution and nation-building" and "the only correct theory and policy for the Chinese proletariat and all working people to liberate themselves".
